finding: The study linked this SNP to the intersection between oral microbiota, host gene methylation, and patient outcomes in head and neck squamous cell carcinoma, providing insights into the interactions affecting cancer prognosis.
title: Identification of consensus head and neck cancer-associated microbiota signatures: a meta-analysis of 16S rRNA and The Cancer Microbiome Atlas datasets

finding: The SNP rs38547 near CACNA2D1 was significantly associated with impulsivity and has been previously involved in neurodevelopmental aspects.
title: CADM2 is implicated in impulsive personality and numerous other traits by genome- and phenome-wide association studies in humans and mice

finding: This SNP was significantly linked to gene expression for ACHE, impacting adipose, artery, and heart tissue and was highlighted due to its association with various phenotypes, including resting heart rate.
title: The genetic case for cardiorespiratory fitness as a clinical vital sign and the routine prescription of physical activity in healthcare

finding: The SNP rs4556017 was confirmed as a causal variant with very high certainty (PP=96.2%) and exerted eQTL effects on the ACHE gene. This gene encodes an enzyme involved in neuromuscular functions, which could impact gut motility and hence be relevant to hemorrhoidal disease.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: The SNP rs11770437, associated with the ELN gene, was highlighted as a key variant impacting ECM components, particularly elastin, and was noted for its role in connective tissue integrity and potential links to HEM risk.
title: Genome-wide analysis of 944,133 individuals provides insights into the etiology of hemorrhoidal disease

finding: This SNP was associated with the cis-expression of PRKAG2 and regulation of IFNB1 upon Mtb infection, indicating a significant role in cytokine expression pathways related to TB immunity.
title: Mycobacterium tuberculosis-dependent Monocyte Expression Quantitative Trait Loci and Tuberculosis Pathogenesis

finding: As a sentinel variant for short-term effectiveness, rs35443123 indicated genetic factors contributing to successful smoking cessation with varenicline.
title: Genome-wide association study of varenicline-aided smoking cessation

finding: The SNP rs6943555 in the AUTS2 gene was associated with schizophrenia in male patients within a Turkish population, suggesting a notable role for this variant in the disease's etiology.
title: Cerebral Organoids Containing an AUTS2 Missense Variant Model Microcephaly

finding: This variant was associated with increased risk for T2D and disrupted a binding motif related to adipogenesis, highlighting its interaction with the LEP gene, which plays a significant role in regulating energy homeostasis.
title: Rare variant association analysis in 51,256 type 2 diabetes cases and 370,487 controls informs the spectrum of pathogenicity of monogenic diabetes genes

finding: The SNP rs112941445 showed significant higher expression levels in the temporal cortex of AD patients compared to controls with an adjusted P-value of 1.1x10-5, suggesting a potential causal role in AD.
title: Whole-genome sequencing reveals new Alzheimer’s disease-associated rare variants in loci related to synaptic function and neuronal development

finding: The SNP rs1990621 was identified as a protective variant associated with frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD) and showed a connection with increased neuronal proportion. This finding was part of a broader investigation into genetic risk factors for neurodegenerative diseases, including Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: New insights on the genetic etiology of Alzheimer’s and related dementia

finding: This SNP rs5011436 was found to be in linkage disequilibrium (LD, R²=0.92) with a 323 bp Alu deletion located on the exon 8 of TMEM106B, supporting its involvement in AD risk.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The SNP rs13237518 was also in LD (R²=0.90) with the aforementioned Alu deletion in the TMEM106B gene, suggesting a role in Alzheimer's disease.
title: Structural Variation Detection and Association Analysis of Whole-Genome-Sequence Data from 16,905 Alzheimer’s Diseases Sequencing Project Subjects

finding: The rs60871478 locus at 7p22 was identified as a novel association with increased levels of p-tau across all disease states. It colocalized with the brain gene DNAAF5, indicating its relevance in neurodegenerative disease mechanisms.
title: Genome-wide meta-analysis of CSF biomarkers in Alzheimer’s disease and Parkinson’s disease cohorts

finding: This female-specific SNP located near CYP3A7 showed a significant association with BMD in women, emphasizing the relevance of sex-differential genetic factors.
title: GWAS of ∼30,000 samples with bone mineral density at multiple skeletal sites and its clinical relevance on fracture prediction, genetic correlations and prioritization of drug targets

finding: The SNP rs34029083 was associated with 13 autoencoder-derived embedded features within a p-value range from 5 x 10^-8 to 5 x 10^-9. Although linked to CACNA2D1, it was notably not previously associated with any ophthalmic phenotype at a genome-wide level, highlighting its potential as an important genetic variant in retinal studies.
title: Autoencoder-based phenotyping of ophthalmic images highlights genetic loci influencing retinal morphology and provides epidemiologically informative biomarkers

finding: The C/T single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP rs1527479) in the CD36 promoter was found to associate with insulin resistance and type 2 diabetes (T2D) in humans. This connection highlighted CD36's role in glucose metabolism and insulin action.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: A rare nonsense mutation (rs56381858) was linked to autosomal dominant T2D in a Caucasian pedigree, underscoring the importance of CD36 variants in the genetic predisposition to T2D.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: Genome-wide association analysis revealed that SNP (rs17236824) is associated with reductions in CD36 expression in muscle and heart, which correlated with T2D complications affecting renal, ophthalmic, and neurological systems.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: The coding SNP rs3211938 (G/T) was identified as the major cause of CD36 deficiency in African Americans, where carriers of the minor G allele exhibited a 50% reduction in CD36 protein levels. This deficiency was shown to have consequential impacts on insulin sensitivity and glucose disposal.
title: Microvascular insulin resistance associates with enhanced muscle glucose disposal in CD36 deficiency

finding: Located in EIF4HP1, rs10250340 was recognized for its significant association with PSA, thus enhancing the understanding of genetic factors involved.
title: Leveraging Genetic Determinants of Prostate-Specific Antigen Levels Towards Improving Prostate Cancer Screening

finding: The candidate causal variant rs45446698 at the 7q22.1 locus was found to associate with decreased expression of CYP3A7, an enzyme that metabolizes testosterone. This variant was linked to increased levels of total and bioavailable testosterone in women and was part of the analysis suggesting its role in endometrial cancer risk through altered sex-hormone levels.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study identifies novel endometrial cancer risk loci that are associated with obesity or female testosterone levels

finding: The rs13245012 variant within the PPIA-H2AZ2-PURB locus was associated with an increased risk of ASXL1-CH, providing an OR of 1.20 [1.13-1.27] and a P-value of 1.60 x 10^-9, highlighting its role as a novel risk locus in this context.
title: Comparative analysis of 136,401 Admixed Americans and 419,228 Europeans reveals ancestry-specific genetic determinants of clonal haematopoiesis

finding: The minor C-allele at rs4410790 was negatively associated with cereal intake (beta=-0.038) and positively associated with coffee intake (beta=0.120). This SNP was associated with increased body mass index (BMI), triglycerides, and decreased HDL cholesterol through increased coffee intake, showcasing its role in metabolic health.
title: Increased brain volume from higher cereal and lower coffee intake: Shared genetic determinants and impacts on cognition and metabolism

finding: The SNP rs12707188 on chromosome 7q33 was associated with umbilical and diaphragmatic hernia at genome-wide significance. This analysis revealed an interesting relationship where the risk allele for umbilical hernia was protective against diaphragmatic hernia, suggesting a possible inverse relationship in their genetic risk factors.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: The SNP rs10224499 tagged the gene ELN on chromosome 7q11.23, which encodes elastin, a critical protein for tissue elasticity. Its association with hernias suggests a direct link between elastin levels and hernia risk.
title: Comprehensive genome-wide association study of different forms of hernia identifies more than 80 associated loci

finding: This SNP was associated with PDE1C and indicated significant links to dopamine regulation in the context of tobacco use.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: This SNP associated with FOXP2 was noted for its significance in understanding genetic contributions to addiction.
title: Multivariate genome-wide association meta-analysis of over 1 million subjects identifies loci underlying multiple substance use disorders

finding: The SNP rs113952142, associated with SDK1, revealed interaction with LTST for SBP, crucial in Hispanic analysis, with a significant P-value of 1.8×10^-6, suggesting its relevance in hypertension.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Study of Gene-Sleep Duration Interactions for Blood Pressure in 811,405 Individuals from Diverse Populations

finding: The variant rs221783, an intergenic variant, was associated with decreased glucose (p = 1.8 × 10^-11, effect = -0.03 SD) and HbA1c (p = 3.6 × 10^-7, effect = -0.02 SD) levels, as well as increased cholesterol (p = 7.0 × 10^-12, effect = 0.03 SD). It was also linked to a decreased risk of T2D (p = 0.005, OR = 0.96) and hypothyroidism (p = 6.95 × 10^-7, OR = 0.92). This association with glucose levels replicated in an independent cohort, Biobank Japan (p = 1.7 × 10^-4). Conditional analysis indicated that the associations of rs221783 with glucose and HbA1c were independent of each other.
title: Gene-level analysis of rare variants in 363,977 whole exome sequences identifies an association of GIGYF1 loss of function with type 2 diabetes

finding: rs199347, associated with GPNMB, was identified as contributing to the likelihood of 'moderate' PD progression, indicating that the non-reference allele elevated the risk.
title: Artificial Intelligence-Based Clustering and Characterization of Parkinson’s Disease Trajectories

finding: The SNP rs45446698 was identified as genome-wide significant in both males and females. It mapped to the CYP3A7 gene, which is involved in the metabolism of estradiol. The minor (G) allele was associated with increased expression of CYP3A7 but correspondingly decreased estradiol levels.
title: Genome-Wide Association Study of Estradiol Levels, and the Causal Effect of Estradiol on Bone Mineral Density

finding: The SNP rs13235997 was highlighted in studies related to oral cavity squamous cell carcinoma and its treatment outcomes, particularly in the context of irradiated neck areas after surgery. The findings indicated that variations in this SNP might have implications for the response to postoperative unilateral neck irradiation in buccal mucosa carcinoma patients.
title: Contralateral Neck Recurrence Rates After Ipsilateral Neck Adjuvant Radiation in Head and Neck Carcinomas with a Pathologically Negative Contralateral Neck

finding: The SNP rs1064794328 was found in previous studies to be linked with long telomeres. In this study, mTL was found to be, on average, 422 bp longer in carriers of this variant compared to wild types, with a significance of P=0.038.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: Similar to rs1064794328, the SNP rs947005337 was identified as a candidate variant linked to long telomeres. It contributed to the understanding of telomere biology related to tumor risks, although specific average length differences were not reported for this SNP in the abstract.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: The SNP rs587777476 was also included as a variant associated with long telomeres, aligning with findings from previous research. However, specific statistical results regarding its association with mTL were not detailed in the abstract.
title: Long-telomeropathy is associated with tumor predisposition syndrome

finding: This SNP was found to harbor genes connected with thyroid traits in mice, thus supporting its association with hypothyroidism.
title: Uncovering the Shared Genetic Components of Thyroid Disorders and Reproductive Health

finding: The variant rs8176058 was positively associated with blood donorship and served as a tag SNP for Kell blood group antigen, indicating a potential link between blood group antigens and donor eligibility.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: The finding related to rs113993960, which is identified as the CFTR F508del variant, was a significant marker associated with cystic fibrosis in a large cohort of 181,776 participants from the All of Us database. PheWAS analysis demonstrated phenotype profiles associated with the presence of this pathogenic variant, utilizing data adjusted for age, sex, and relevant genetic principal components.
title: PheWAS analysis on large-scale biobank data with PheTK

finding: The rs4731702 variant was a lead <italic>cis</italic>-eQTL for the <italic>KLF14</italic> transcription factor, which was associated with the expression of 385 target genes in <italic>trans</italic>. This variant had independent <italic>cis</italic> associations for other metabolic traits, suggesting it played a significant role in regulating metabolic pathways.
title: USP18 modulates lupus risk via negative regulation of interferon response

finding: The rs12700027 variant showed significant heterogeneity across ancestry groups with a strong positive association in European ancestry (beta=0.0327, p=1.2e-15). It was nominally replicated with p=0.0065.
title: Genome-wide association study of prostate-specific antigen levels in 392,522 men identifies new loci and improves cross-ancestry prediction

finding: The CYP3A5 rs776746 variant increased the risk for chronic kidney disease (CKD) with a hazard ratio of 2.12 (p=0.002) compared to GG homozygotes. It was also associated with an increased likelihood of switching from dCCB to alternative antihypertensive medications (HR 1.59, 95% CI 1.09 to 2.32, p=0.02), indicating a significant impact on treatment efficacy.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The ABCB1 rs2032582 AA homozygotes were significantly more likely to have edema, with a prevalence of 1.18% (n=75 out of 6,354) and a hazard ratio of 1.65 (95% CI 1.18 to 2.32, p=0.03) compared to CC homozygotes. This result highlights a specific adverse effect linked to this genetic variant.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The CYP3A4 rs2740574 CC homozygotes faced increased risk for hospital-diagnosed CKD compared to other homozygote groups with an HR of 1.14 (95% CI 1.01 to 1.29, p=0.04). This underscores the importance of considering this SNP in managing CKD risk.
title: Calcium Channel Blockers: clinical outcome associations with reported pharmacogenetics variants in 32,000 patients

finding: The rs41279633 variant, in the NPC1L1 gene, was connected to cholesterol absorption and was significant in CAD association studies.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: The rs2107595 variant near HDAC9/TWIST1 was discussed in context with fine-mapping techniques for CAD.
title: Discovery and systematic characterization of risk variants and genes for coronary artery disease in over a million participants

finding: NOS3 (rs2070744) was found to be associated only with early T2D diagnosis. This SNP influenced T2D development, particularly in the male group with an early diagnosis.
title: Sex-specific genetic loci linked to early and late onset type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs4410790, located within the AHR gene, was also positively associated with fasting plasma caffeine levels. Similar to rs2472297, this variant contributed to understanding the relationship between caffeine metabolism and BMI, further validating the critical role of the AHR gene in caffeine-related metabolic pathways.
title: Comparison of caffeine consumption behavior with plasma caffeine levels as exposures in drug-target Mendelian randomization and implications for interpreting effects on obesity

finding: The SNP rs10486483 was associated with Crohn's Disease. Initially, its credible set contained 85 variants, but after applying the FDR threshold of 0.10, this set was significantly reduced to just 3 variants, indicating that the model could effectively prioritize potentially causal variants within the GWAS locus.
title: TSABL: Trait Specific Annotation Based Locus Predictor

finding: The SNP rs6466720 located in a non-coding region of chromosome 7 was significantly associated with the EBV amino acid variant BRLF1:p.Lys316Glu, which is implicated in controlling lytic reactivation of EBV from latency.
title: The influence of human genetic variation on Epstein-Barr virus sequence diversity

finding: The SNP rs12530627 was identified as critical in the Pain Questionnaire cohort and was one of the SNPs replicated in the fibromyalgia cohort, indicating its relevance in both contexts.
title: Genetic Risk Factors for ME/CFS Identified using Combinatorial Analysis

finding: The rs4717903 SNP within GTF2I was replicated in recent HF GWAS after Bonferroni correction, reinforcing its genetic association profile.
title: Genetic Architecture of Heart Failure with Preserved versus Reduced Ejection Fraction

finding: The index SNP rs62474683, located in an intergenic region on chromosome 7, showed significant association with suicide attempt with a p-value of 8.72×10−12. This SNP was found to be the most strongly associated with SA and was replicated showing an odds ratio (A allele) of 1.05, suggesting a modest increase in risk.
title: Genome-wide association study meta-analysis of suicide attempt in 43,871 cases identifies twelve genome-wide significant loci

finding: The SNP rs2282989 was significantly associated with neutrophil cell count in a large dataset of 471,532 individuals. This association supports the role of CDK6 in influencing immune responses in critically ill COVID-19 patients.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs42041 was identified as significantly associated with neutrophil cell count, with statistical significance demonstrated in the analysis of 471,532 subjects. This finding reinforced the notion that variations in the CDK6 gene could affect immune overreactions in severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs42030 was found to be significantly associated with neutrophil cell count. This association was part of a broader study involving 471,532 subjects, highlighting the involvement of CDK6 in the immune response during critical illness in COVID-19 patients.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The SNP rs78366656 was significantly linked to neutrophil cell count in a large-scale analysis with 471,532 participants, suggesting a genetic role of CDK6 in the immune response mechanisms in patients suffering from severe COVID-19.
title: Neutrophils cause critical illness in COVID-19 and reveal CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: SNP rs12539059 positively regulated khallagem as a cancer-related gene. Its association underlined concerns about cancer risk in terms of blood product implications.
title: Genome-wide association study reveals the unique genetic structure of active blood donors

finding: Linking this SNP to the SP4 gene, it was identified by multiple post-GWAS analyses, highlighting its regulatory importance in astrocytes and GABAergic neurons.
title: Genomics yields biological and phenotypic insights into bipolar disorder

finding: The SNP rs7808966, upstream of RNF32, was associated with pituitary gland volume (β = 0.03, MAF = 0.07), indicating its relevance to reproductive traits governed by testosterone.
title: Genome-wide analysis identifies 66 variants underlying anatomical variation in human neuroendocrine structures and reveals links to testosterone

finding: Identified in the context of coffee consumption, this SNP (AGR3-AHR) was also reported by CCGC as being significant for coffee-related genetic studies.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This SNP, related to the locus MLXIPL-VPS37D, was previously reported by CCGC; it is associated with coffee consumption.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This SNP was previously associated with coffee consumption according to CCGC data, affirming its relevance in this context.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: This index SNP was previously reported and is connected to coffee consumption studies, demonstrating its importance.
title: Habitual Coffee Consumption Increases Risks for Metabolic Diseases: Genome-wide Association Studies and a Phenotype-wide Two Sample Mendelian Randomization Analysis

finding: The variant rs6461378, coding for SUN1 H118Y, was identified as the top variant associated with hepatic steatosis in a meta-analysis of 120,000 participants and had significant associations with several metabolic traits linked to nonalcoholic fatty liver disease (NAFLD), including type 2 diabetes and hypertension. Further validation in additional cohorts confirmed its association with high serum fatty acids, low HDL levels, and increased insulin resistance, suggesting a causal relationship between this variant and metabolic disease. Functional assays revealed that SUN1 H118Y exhibited increased degradation compared to the wild-type via proteasomal pathways, further supporting its role in insulin resistance and lipid accumulation.
title: A common variant that alters SUN1 degradation associates with hepatic steatosis and metabolic traits in multiple cohorts

finding: The minor A-allele of SNP rs77466830 was associated with a decrease in NUB1 expression in SS patients, while remaining stable in healthy individuals, highlighting its significance in SS-related gene regulation.
title: An integrative multi-omics approach in Sjögren’s Syndrome identifies novel genetic drivers with regulatory function and disease-specificity

finding: The analysis indicated SNP rs4489253 with a p-value of 8.39×10−6, with specific allele frequency details not reported. This SNP is located near the TRIM56 gene, which plays a significant role in ubiquitination processes.
title: Genomic predictors of response to antidepressants in Major depressive disorder (MDD): A GWAS-Based Study on Indian cohort

finding: Variant rs6460068 was associated with aortic root diameter and aortic valve mean gradient, overlapping a VIC enhancer predicted to regulate elastin (ELN), indicating its role in valvular structure.
title: Molecular convergence of risk variants for congenital heart defects leveraging a regulatory map of the human fetal heart

finding: The SNP rs11982272, located in the gene MAD1L1, was previously reported as a shared risk locus for both ADHD and disruptive behavior disorders (DBD). It showed only a moderate association with ADHD in a large GWAS, suggesting its relevance in the context of ADHD. Furthermore, MAD1L1 has been linked to schizophrenia and bipolar disorder, indicating its potential role as a risk gene across multiple psychiatric disorders.
title: Integrative multi-omics analysis of genomic, epigenomic, and metabolomics data leads to new insights for Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder

finding: The rs1990622 variant was associated with protection against frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TAR DNA binding protein inclusions (FTLD-TDP), exhibiting an odds ratio of 0.61 and a p-value of 1.08×10-11. This association was noted to possibly extend to amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), indicating its significance in neurodegenerative disease risk.
title: An AluYb8 retrotransposon characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs13237518 variant was associated with protection against Alzheimer's disease, showing an odds ratio of 0.96 with a p-value of 4.90×10-11. This finding highlights its potential relevance in neurodegenerative disease susceptibility.
title: An AluYb8 retrotransposon characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs80308281, located near the SLC12A9 gene, was found to be associated with retinal Df. This variant has also been implicated in regulating arterial blood pressure and heart rate, thus linking it to cardiovascular health.
title: Proteome-wide Mendelian randomization study implicates inflammaging biomarkers in retinal vasculature, cardiometabolic diseases and longevity

finding: The study reported that rs3789806 was part of a 5% VAF mixture experiment involving human cell line genomic DNA from NA18537 and NA18562. It was identified among somatic single-base mutations despite the high error rates of nanopore sequencing, which complicated the detection of variants at low frequencies.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: Similar to rs3789806, rs9648696 was analyzed in a 5% VAF context between NA18537 and NA18562. The SNP was successfully called as a variant amidst the high error rate challenges of nanopore sequencing, indicating its significance in somatic mutation detection.
title: Oncogene Concatenated Enriched Amplicon Nanopore Sequencing for Rapid, Accurate, and Affordable Somatic Mutation Detection

finding: The SNP rs115038698 at the ABCB4 locus was found to be in high LD with the missense variant rs61730509, showing a significant association with increased risk of cALT and demonstrating potent effects linked to metabolic conditions.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The missense variant rs61730509 (Ala934Thr) at the ABCB4 locus was validated to have a direct impact on cALT levels, reinforcing the genetic association with NAFLD and indicating its role in lipid transport in hepatocytes.
title: A genome-wide association study of chronic ALT-based non-alcoholic fatty liver disease in the Million Veteran Program with histological and radiological validation

finding: The SNP rs10276547 was highlighted for its significance within the context of the study, particularly involving the WHAMM gene.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: This SNP was associated with the NDUFA5 gene and showed significant eQTL activity linked to mRNA levels, denoting its role in KD.
title: Pharmacogenomics of Coronary Artery Response to Intravenous Gamma Globulin in Kawasaki Disease

finding: The variant rs141647689 in the SDK1 gene was associated with multiple cancers, particularly urinary bladder cancer, with an odds ratio of 9.29 among individuals also diagnosed with prostate cancer.
title: Assessment of Genetic Susceptibility to Multiple Primary Cancers through Whole-Exome Sequencing in Two Large Multi-Ancestry Studies

finding: This SNP was validated as an allele-specific enhancer of IRF5, a key SLE risk gene, further underscoring its role in modulating immune responses linked to SLE.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This trans-eQTL SNP was associated with IKZF1 and identified as having multiple immune-related target genes, establishing its significance in SLE susceptibility.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: This SNP caused a mutation in NCF1, resulting in protein destabilization and implicating it in altered reactive oxygen species production, which is crucial for immune responses.
title: A multilayered post-GWAS analysis pipeline defines functional variants and target genes for systemic lupus erythematosus (SLE)

finding: The SNP rs2072443 was identified as a loss-of-function variant of TMEM176B, which significantly affected IL-1β release in primary human monocytes and monocyte-derived macrophages, with partial effects in lymphocytes. This finding suggested a role for TMEM176B in modulating NLRP3 inflammasome activity in leukocytes, supporting the hypothesis that TMEM176B influences anti-cancer immune responses in conjunction with colorectal cancer (CRC) progression.
title: Inverse correlation between NLRP3 and TMEM176B as a possible tool for colorectal cancer progression

finding: The SNP rs3918226, found in the intron of the NOS3 gene, showed increased significance for HF with a P-value of 1.09×10^-22 in MTAG analysis, significantly improving from its original association at P=5.98×10^-5.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide analysis identified novel risk loci and candidate drugs for heart failure

finding: The SNP rs2528382 was fine-mapped by the SuShiE model to regulate expression levels of the gene URGCP, which is implicated in tumor growth and progression. This finding was supported by credible sets in mRNA data from TOPMed-MESA, where rs2528382 was the only SNP identified. It replicated in visit-5 mRNA data and was noted as significant in diverse eQTL studies. Functional annotations indicated that rs2528382 is a non-coding exon variant within the 5' UTR and localizes within a proximal enhancer region as shown by H3K27ac signals in PBMCs. Moreover, the SNP's presence within open chromatin accessibility regions was confirmed through snATAC-seq and scATAC-seq data across various cell types, suggesting it disrupts regulatory activity to control URGCP gene expression.
title: Improved multi-ancestry fine-mapping identifies cis-regulatory variants underlying molecular traits and disease risk

finding: This SNP in GRM8, significant for TUD, is critical for reward-related learning and memory in the context of smoking behavior.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis of tobacco use disorders based on electronic health record data prioritizes novel candidate risk genes and reveals associations with numerous health outcomes

finding: The SNP rs144380855 reached genome-wide significance for gestational length with a beta value of -2.07 and a P-value of 5.3×10^-10. This intergenic SNP indicates potential associations with reduced gestational length.
title: Genetic Polymorphisms Associated with Adverse Pregnancy Outcomes in Nulliparas

finding: The index variant rs9065 associated with the <italic>PDIA4</italic> locus indicated genetic upregulation of both transcript and protein levels contributing to increased sCJD risk. It demonstrated strong evidence of eQTL-GWAS colocalization and was identified in multiple brain datasets indicating an active role in excitatory neurons.
title: Multiomic Analyses Direct Hypotheses for Creutzfeldt-Jakob Disease Risk Genes

finding: The novel missense variant rs75326924 was associated with TSH in a GWAS and demonstrated a unique low frequency in East Asian populations, informing on its potential role in metabolism related to thyroid function.
title: Genome-wide association studies in a large Korean cohort identify novel quantitative trait loci for 36 traits and illuminates their genetic architectures

finding: The rs6968865 SNP within the AHR locus exhibited a discordant genome-wide significant association with increased difficulty awakening (beta conditional = 0.011, p = 3.20×10^{-11}) and morning chronotype in conditional analysis (beta conditional = -0.04, p = 2.40×10^{-10}). The marginal analyses showed only nominal associations with difficulty awakening (beta marginal = 0.007, p = 4.55×10^{-5}) and morning chronotype (beta marginal = -0.02, p = 0.0002), further supporting its involvement in circadian functioning.
title: Sleep inertia drives the association of evening chronotype with psychiatric disorders: epidemiological and genetic evidence

finding: The lead SNP rs2107595 was reported as strongly associated with abdominal aortic calcification (AAC), with a p-value of 1.47×10−20. It was identified in a non-coding region near the genes HDAC9 and TWIST1, with implications suggesting that it increases TWIST1 expression, potentially leading to vascular calcification and increased risks for cardiovascular diseases.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: rs57301765 was included in the credible set for AAC when considering fine mapping at the rs2107595 locus. It showed strong linkage with rs2107595 and was evaluated alongside CAD and SBP traits, reinforcing its potential role in cardiovascular risk factors.
title: Calcification of abdominal aorta is a high risk underappreciated cardiovascular disease factor in a general population

finding: Identified on chromosome 7, rs7776725 was associated with accelerated brain aging and mapped to the intron of the FAM3C gene, which encodes a secreted protein related to pancreatic cancer and Alzheimer's disease. This SNP was validated by another study for its association with specific modes of brain aging, adding to its importance in understanding the genetic underpinnings of neurodegenerative processes.
title: Population clustering of structural brain aging and its association with brain development

finding: The SNP rs5011436, located in an intron of the TMEM106B gene, was significantly associated with Alzheimer's disease (AD) and depression in a study utilizing data from the UK Biobank. Specifically, the study found a negative association with AD, where carriers of the C allele had a correlation coefficient (B) of -0.002 (p=9.1×10^-4), indicating that having more C alleles was protective against AD. Conversely, the same C allele was positively associated with depression, showing a B value of 0.007 (p=3.2×10^-9). Moreover, neuroimaging analyses revealed that the C allele was linked to larger volumes in specific brain regions, such as higher volumes in the posterior, mid posterior, and anterior corpus callosum sections, a lower volume in the third ventricle, and an increased area in the inferior temporal gyrus. These findings suggested a complex relationship between genetic variants and brain morphology in the context of both AD and depression.
title: Genetic overlap between Alzheimer’s disease and depression mapped onto the brain

finding: The rs1990622 risk allele located in the TMEM106B gene was previously associated with the age at onset (AAO) in patients with sporadic behavioural variant Frontotemporal Dementia (bvFTD). The presence of this allele was linked to variations in AAO, contributing to the understanding of genetic factors affecting the timing of disease onset. This indicates a potential interplay between genetic variation and the expression of disease in bvFTD.
title: Anterior cingulate sulcation is associated with onset and survival in frontotemporal dementia

finding: The SNP rs45446698 showed a significant association with 4-androsten-3alpha,17alpha-diol monosulfate (2). Individuals who were TT homozygotes had higher and more stable levels of this sulfated steroid compared to TG heterozygotes. This finding highlighted the influence of genetic variability on steroid metabolism regulated by the CYP3A7 gene.
title: Longitudinal analysis of genetic and environmental interplay in human metabolic profiles and the implication for metabolic health

finding: The SNP rs11979881 was linked to chronotype through a novel connection with the ARMC10 gene. This finding added to the body of evidence for genetic influences on sleep phenotypes and may suggest a new area for research in chronotype.
title: Mendelian randomisation analysis using GWAS and eQTL data to investigate the relationship between chronotype and neuropsychiatric disorders and their molecular basis

finding: The SNP rs5011436 was in high linkage disequilibrium (LD) with a 343 bp deletion that removed an Alu element from the 3' UTR of the TMEM106B gene. This deletion showed a strong association with various Alzheimer’s Disease (AD) and Related Disorders (ADRD) phenotypes, including tangle density, TDP-43, and cognitive resilience. The association was nominally significant with a p-value of 7.72 x 10^-4, indicating its relevance in the genetic investigation of AD.
title: Structural variants linked to Alzheimer’s Disease and other common age-related clinical and neuropathologic traits

finding: Included in the 47 lead variants reported in the analysis, this SNP was significant in its association with HF, further affirming its relevance.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP was one of the significant findings in the context of HF, part of the 47 lead variants exhibiting a strong association.
title: Common- and rare-variant genetic architecture of heart failure across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The variant rs868824, intronic to IMMP2L, was replicated as associated with age at onset with a beta of -1.0935 years (p=4.31×10^-4), although it did not show significant findings for severity.
title: Not all roads lead to the immune system: The Genetic Basis of Multiple Sclerosis Severity Implicates Central Nervous System and Mitochondrial Involvement

finding: The Leu1174Met (rs73547325) SNP in the MGAM2 gene was identified as a hypomorphic variant. This variant was common, detected in 18 patients in the dietary arm of the DOMINO study, and was linked to an increased response rate to the FODMAP-lowering diet among IBS patients.
title: Functional variation in human Carbohydrate-Active enZYmes (hCAZymes) in relation to the efficacy of a FODMAP-reducing diet in IBS patients

finding: Located in the left/right lateral ventricle, the SNP rs4557589 linked it substantially to sleep characteristics.
title: Mapping sleep’s phenotypic and genetic links to the brain and heart: a systematic analysis of multimodal brain and cardiac images in the UK Biobank

finding: The findings indicated that the minor allele of rs1990622 (rs1990622_G) was protective against frontotemporal lobar dementia with TDP pathology (FTLD-TDP) with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.61, while the major allele was risk-increasing (OR=1.64). This allele also showed linkage to increased plasma levels of progranulin (GRN), suggesting a mechanism of protection against GRN haploinsufficiency.
title: A 3’ UTR Deletion Is a Leading Candidate Causal Variant at the TMEM106B Locus Reducing Risk for FTLD-TDP

finding: In a recent large Alzheimer’s Disease GWAS, rs13237518 was identified as protective with an odds ratio (OR) of 0.96, although it conferred less protection than rs1990622, demonstrating significance in the context of amyloid-related pathologies.
title: A 3’ UTR Deletion Is a Leading Candidate Causal Variant at the TMEM106B Locus Reducing Risk for FTLD-TDP

finding: The variant rs3735260 in AUTS2 represented the strongest SNP association found in this study concerning a neurodevelopmental trait, which is linked to dyslexia.
title: Discovery of 42 Genome-Wide Significant Loci Associated with Dyslexia

finding: The intergenic SNP rs2699453 was part of the credible set for causal variants in the analyses surrounding PAU, indicating its significance in this genetic study.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The intergenic variant rs2098112 appeared in the fine-mapping analysis associated with PAU, contributing to the evidence of multiple genetic factors underlying problematic alcohol use.
title: Multi-ancestry study of the genetics of problematic alcohol use in >1 million individuals

finding: The SNP rs2908286, located within the GCK gene, reached genome-wide significance in individuals of African descent, showing a strong association with random glucose measurements (RG). This association contributed to understanding the role of GCK in glucose sensing.
title: Random glucose GWAS in 493,036 individuals provides insights into diabetes pathophysiology, complications and treatment stratification

finding: This SNP demonstrated a GWS association in the OUD-MTAG study connected to the FOXP2 gene, implicating its role in the genetic factors influencing OUD.
title: Genome-wide association study and multi-trait analysis of opioid use disorder identifies novel associations in 639,709 individuals of European and African ancestry

finding: This SNP is a cis-eQTL for IKZF1, which is essential for B cell differentiation and related to immunoglobulin heavy chain rearrangement.
title: Leveraging pleiotropy identifies common-variant associations with selective IgA deficiency

finding: The variant rs573762901, located in the CALN1 gene, showed evidence for association with HDL-c in relation to LTST, indicating its potential impact on lipid profiles influenced by sleep duration.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: The rs543672875 variant, located in the ALKBH4 gene, interacted with HDL-c levels under short total sleep time (STST), revealing its connection to sleep-modified lipid profiles.
title: A Large-Scale Genome-Wide Gene-Sleep Interaction Study in 732,564 Participants Identifies Lipid Loci Explaining Sleep-Associated Lipid Disturbances

finding: Linked to fatty acid traits as a novel candidate, indicating a possible role in metabolic pathways.
title: Genome-wide association studies and multi-omics integrative analysis reveal novel loci and their molecular mechanisms for circulating polyunsaturated, monounsaturated, and saturated fatty acids

finding: The SNP rs12666575 in the MAD1L1 gene was implicated in a study as being genetically associated with schizophrenia susceptibility. This association highlighted a potential connection between genetic variations in MAD1L1 and neurodevelopmental disorders, further suggesting that genetic factors such as this SNP could play a role in the neurodevelopmental delays observed in children exposed to prenatal tobacco and alcohol.
title: DNA Methylation as a Potential Mediator of the Association Between Prenatal Tobacco and Alcohol Exposure and Child Neurodevelopment in a South African Birth Cohort

finding: At locus 7q32.1, the SNP rs35000415 in the IRF5 gene showed a significant association with SLE, having a P-value of 1.9×10^-45, consistent in both EU and Chi groups.
title: Genome-wide Association Clustering Meta-analysis in European and Chinese Datasets for Systemic Lupus Erythematosus identifies new genes

finding: The SNP rs373418736 was identified as a rare variant with a minor allele frequency of less than 0.1%. It was part of a significant PW coding model associated with low glucose levels at the 5' end of the GCK gene, indicating a direction of effect different from most of the gene.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs143484733 also featured in the significant PW coding model for the GCK gene, exhibiting an opposite direction of effect from the majority of the coding variants, where it related to low glucose levels, demonstrating the complexity of the gene's phenotypic effects.
title: A power-based sliding window approach to evaluate the clinical impact of rare genetic variants

finding: The rs2897075_T allele was associated with increased risk for both IPF and COVID-19. This variant was linked to decreased expression of TRIM4 and ZKSCAN1, both relevant to immune response pathways, indicating potential implications for how viral infections may trigger chronic lung disease and influence COVID-19 severity.
title: Genetic overlap between idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis and COVID−19

finding: The SNP rs17139584 on chromosome 7 was identified as the most significant association for bacterial pneumonia with a p-value of 1.21 × 10^-36. Its association remained nominally significant even after adjusting for cystic fibrosis status, indicating its potential independent role in bacterial pneumonia risk.
title: The genetic architecture of human infectious diseases and pathogen-induced cellular phenotypes

finding: This SNP was part of a super variant identified on Chromosome 7, which had an odds ratio (OR) of 1.594 and a significance p-value of 5.47×10^-9. It was associated with susceptibility to COVID-19 related mortality.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Located on Chromosome 7 as part of a super variant with an OR of 1.594 (p=5.47×10^-9), this SNP contributed to the risk of COVID-19 mortality.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Included in the significant super variant on Chromosome 7 associated with COVID-19 mortality, showing an OR of 1.594 (p=5.47×10^-9).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Found in a significant super variant on Chromosome 7 related to COVID-19 mortality with an OR of 1.594 and p-value 5.47×10^-9.
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Identified in the impactful super variant on Chromosome 7 associated with COVID-19 mortality risk, showing an OR of 1.594 (p=5.47×10^-9).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: Located within the chr7_43 super variant associated with COVID-19 mortality risk and showed a noteworthy OR of 1.370 (p=7.61×10^-7).
title: Deep learning identified genetic variants associated with COVID-19 related mortality

finding: The SNP rs3807865 was significantly associated with the broad phenotype depression (β = 0.033, SE = 0.005, p = 4.74 × 10^-11), consistent with previous GWAS findings.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: SNP rs1554505 was significantly associated with the ICD10-coded depression phenotype (β = -0.047, SE = 0.013, p = 2.04 × 10^-4), corroborating previous research.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: The SNP rs5011432 was significantly associated with the lifetime phenotype depression (β = 0.048, SE = 0.011, p = 1.96 × 10^-5), aligning with earlier findings.
title: Investigating the role of the relaxin-3/RXFP3 system in neuropsychiatric disorders and metabolic phenotypes: a candidate gene approach

finding: The SNP rs34217249 was identified in a locus at ADAP1, associated with anterior brain arterial diameter at genome-wide significance (P=3.11×10^-8), thus contributing to our understanding of arterial traits.
title: Chromosome 10q24.32 Variants Associate with Brain Arterial Diameters in Diverse Populations: A Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The missense variant rs34985488 in NAT16 contributed to a suggestive association with DKD (p-value 5.82×10^-5), with replication found in the FinnGen CKD dataset. The variant was deemed deleterious according to SIFT and PolyPhen predictions.
title: Whole-exome and Whole-genome Sequencing of 1097 Individuals with Type 1 Diabetes Reveals Novel Genes for Diabetic Kidney Disease

finding: The SNP rs10247428 exhibited a positive association with SHBG levels, specifically in the A/A homozygous state (β = 0.02, P = 0.003), which was in the opposite direction of its relationship with LOY, indicating a distinct interaction.
title: Age-related loss of the Y chromosome is associated with sex hormone binding globulin and selected drivers of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: The variant rs2107595 was prioritized as a candidate causal variant affecting TWIST1 expression through multi-trait colocalization. Increased expression of TWIST1, a master transcription factor related to smooth muscle cell plasticity during atherogenesis, was linked to a reduced risk of IA. The variant influences a DNAse hypersensitivity site, modulating TWIST1 expression and, consequently, promoting smooth muscle cell proliferation and matrix production that may stabilize the vascular wall and lower IA risk.
title: Dissecting the Genetic Architecture of Intracranial Aneurysms

finding: The SNP rs7783012 was identified as one of the two genome-wide significant independent SNPs associated with cannabis use disorder based on data from the Psychiatric Genomics Consortium, iPSYCH, and deCODE studies, involving a large cohort of individuals from both European and African ancestries. This association suggests a link between this SNP and predisposition to cannabis use disorder.
title: Association between cannabis use and brain imaging phenotypes in UK Biobank: an observational and Mendelian randomization study

finding: The rs734004 genotype CG was identified as being associated with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC). This finding suggested a potential protective role of this SNP against the risk of developing GC.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: The rs734005 genotype TC was found to correlate with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC). This indicated that this specific SNP may help reduce the risk of developing GC.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: The rs2072407 genotype TC was associated with decreased susceptibility to gastric cancer (GC), implying that this SNP may contribute to a lower risk of GC.
title: EZH2: A Critical Competing Endogenous RNA in Cancer Research - A Scoping Review

finding: This non-synonymous variant in CUX1 was noted as having significant linkage with the lead SNPs and was highlighted as potentially deleterious, also implicated in neurodevelopmental disorders and autism.
title: Genome-wide significant risk loci for mood disorders in the Old Order Amish founder population

finding: The rs1800795 SNP, associated with inflammation (through IL-6), indicated significant allele frequency patterns that may confer risk for COVID-19 severity.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: Similar to rs1800795, the rs1800796 variant's frequency patterns indicated potential implications for increased COVID-19 severity in the context of inflammatory responses.
title: COVID-19 and Indian population: a comparative genetic analysis

finding: The SNP rs3918226 was recognized as a lead variant in the NOS3 gene regulatory region, having been associated with RS as well as previously with high blood pressure. This indicated a potential role for nitric oxide signaling in vasoconstriction relevant to RS.
title: The α2A-adrenergic receptor (ADRA2A) modulates susceptibility to Raynaud’s syndrome

finding: The single nucleotide variant rs10235487 was identified as a cis-methylation quantitative trait locus (meQTL) that regulated the methylation of cg16500036, a notable feature in the prognostic models of death and major adverse cardiovascular events (MACE). This CpG site was located on an enhancer associated with the AUTS2 gene, indicating that an increase in its methylation level could lead to a decrease in AUTS2 expression. The negative correlation between rs10235487 and AUTS2 expression was significant, with a P value of 4.50E-09, indicating strong evidence linking this SNP to poor outcomes associated with coronary artery disease.
title: DNA Methylation Predicts Adverse Outcomes of Coronary Artery Disease

finding: Found in an intron of Engulfment and Cell Motility 1 (ELMO1), the SNP rs111796602 was identified specifically in European populations with a significant p-value of 1.72 x 10^-8. This indicates a potential genetic influence on pSSNS that is perhaps population-specific.
title: Multi-population genome-wide association study implicates both immune and non-immune factors in the etiology of pediatric steroid sensitive nephrotic syndrome

finding: Located within the TBX20 gene, SNP rs10486660 was associated with placental morphology and influenced its gene expression, indicating a functional role in placental development.
title: Genome-wide association study of placental weight in 179,025 children and parents reveals distinct and shared genetic influences between placental and fetal growth

finding: The intronic variant rs2897075:C>T in ZKSCAN1 increased the risk of hospitalization (OR = 1.05, P = 8.9 × 10^-9) and was involved in idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis (IPF) susceptibility.
title: A second update on mapping the human genetic architecture of COVID-19

finding: The rs3173615 variant, a non-synonymous coding variant (Thr185Ser) in exon 6 of TMEM106B, was associated with the protective haplotype. Although predicted to be 'benign' and having no observable functional change in a CRISPR-based mouse model, it correlated with a risk haplotype that demonstrated a higher aggregation potential, particularly in neurodegenerative contexts.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element further characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The rs1990620 variant reportedly decreased the recruitment of CCCTC-binding factors (CTCF), which affected long-range chromatin interactions leading to lower expression of TMEM106B, though it was associated with the protective haplotype.
title: An AluYb8 mobile element further characterises a risk haplotype of TMEM106B associated in neurodegeneration

finding: The SNP rs60738304 was associated with Alzheimer's Disease (AD), as demonstrated by its inclusion in the IGAP summary statistics where the beta coefficient was reported as b = 0.68, indicating a substantial effect size on the liability for AD per effect allele. This SNP was used as a pivotal reference point in simulations for recovery of individual SNP effects.
title: Multivariate Modeling of Direct and Proxy GWAS Indicates Substantial Common Variant Heritability of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The missense variant rs6967330 in CDHR3 was associated with increased susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis, particularly when caused by viruses other than RSV. The variant increased the cell surface expression of CDHR3 in airway epithelial cells, facilitating greater replication of rhinovirus-C. This finding was significant in the context of overall and non-RSV bronchiolitis, while it showed no association with RSV-induced bronchiolitis, highlighting its specific role in non-RSV infections.
title: Genetic susceptibility to acute viral bronchiolitis

finding: The SNP rs881926 was associated with increased spinal curvature, particularly linked to kyphosis as identified through fine-mapping studies that focused on kypholordotic angles within the UK Biobank Imaging cohort.
title: Aging of the Spine: Characterizing genetic and physiological determinants of spinal curvature

finding: This lead variant rs78233367 at the locus for the aryl hydrocarbon receptor AHR showed an odds ratio of 1.06 with a p-value of 1.3×10^-8, indicating its contribution to psoriasis susceptibility and relevance for treatment with targeted modulators.
title: GWAS meta-analysis of psoriasis identifies new susceptibility alleles impacting disease mechanisms and therapeutic targets

finding: SNP rs7783012 was linked to externalizing behaviors and was observed to operate via the common liability to addiction, particularly associated with cannabis use.
title: Novel insights into the common heritable liability to addiction: a multivariate genome-wide association study

finding: Patients with the rs11764843 'CA' genotype experienced a slower rate of reduction in negative symptom scores over time when treated with antipsychotics.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The rs1178119 'GA' genotype was correlated with a slower reduction of negative symptoms in patients as assessed by PANSS.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The GRM3 SNP-rs724226 was associated with changes in PANSS total score in African Americans receiving risperidone treatment.
title: Pharmacogenomic diversity in psychiatry: Challenges and Opportunities in Africa

finding: The SNP rs1183079 was associated with the radial distance of the right lateral ventricle and various white matter tracts, also identified as an eQTL for the gene AMZ1.
title: Genetic influences on the shape of brain ventricular and subcortical structures

finding: The SNP rs10273639C/T was significantly associated with alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (ACP) and non-alcoholic chronic pancreatitis (NACP). The risk [C] allele increased the expression of the PRSS1 mRNA in a dosage-dependent manner in pancreatic tissue. The meta-analysis revealed a pooled odds ratio (OR) of 1.67 for ACP and 1.28 for NACP, indicating a strong association for both conditions. An additive genetic model was determined to best fit the data, supporting the presence of a gene-environment interaction with alcohol consumption.
title: Role of the common PRSS1-PRSS2 haplotype in alcoholic and non-alcoholic chronic pancreatitis: meta- and re-analyses

finding: The SNP rs75682113 located on chromosome 7 at 7p14.1 emerged as significantly associated with MSS in the meta-analysis of the MIA and UKB cohorts, with a P-value of 1.07x10^-8 and a HR of 2.38. Although it did not replicate in the LMC (P 0.411), it remained genome-wide significant in the overall analysis after combining discovery and replication cohorts, with a HR of 2.23 and P 2.13x10^-8, indicating no significant evidence of heterogeneity.
title: Higher polygenic risk for melanoma is associated with improved survival

finding: The variant rs10248420 was included in the MDR1-ABCB1 genetic score for mothers, demonstrating significant interaction with prenatal antiseizure medication use and birth weight. The difference in birth weight between exposed and unexposed offspring was -66.8 g in the lowest genetic score category and -317 g in the highest. The interaction showed a <p-value> of 0.037, indicating a strong relationship with lower birth weight relating to maternal genotype.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: The variant rs2235015 was another variant within the MDR1-ABCB1 genetic score for mothers. It exhibited some evidence of interaction with prenatal antiseizure medication use, with a <p-value> for interaction of 0.058, further supporting the association between maternal genetics and lower birth weight outcomes in exposed offspring.
title: Interaction between placental efflux transporters and use of antiseizure or antidepressant drugs during pregnancy on birth weight in the Norwegian Mother, Father and Child Cohort Study

finding: Associated with genes NME8 and GPR141, this SNP was significant in the context of low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: This SNP was associated with CALN1, indicating its relevance in low T1D PRS cases.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: Linked to the gene ZNF804B, this SNP was significant in identifying novel loci related to low T1D PRS.
title: Genetics of Low Polygenic Risk Score Type 1 Diabetes Patients: rare variants in 22 novel loci

finding: The SNP rs13246216 was associated with lipid metabolism alterations in relation to cancer. Specifically, findings indicated that its presence correlated with lipid species involved in inflammatory processes, which could connect to the increased mortality risk seen in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC) patients.
title: Lipid Aging Clocks as predictive and prognostic biomarker in cancer and inflammaging

finding: This SNP was found to be associated with the mild progression subtype (Subtype I) of PD.
title: Comprehensively modeling heterogeneous symptom progression for Parkinson’s disease subtyping

finding: The SNP rs622568 at locus 7p11.2 was also linked significantly to hospitalized COVID-19 with a p-value of 2.57×10⁻⁸, marking it as a relevant factor in the host's genetic landscape surrounding severe COVID-19 cases.
title: Single cell sequencing analysis uncovers genetics-influenced CD16+monocytes and memory CD8+T cells involved in severe COVID-19

finding: The SNP rs776746 was associated with a significant effect on tacrolimus clearance as it is located in the CYP3A5 gene, which encodes the primary enzyme responsible for tacrolimus metabolism. In the study, individuals carrying the CYP3A5*3 loss-of-function allele displayed reduced clearance and required smaller dosages to maintain therapeutic tacrolimus levels. This SNP was estimated to be responsible for 39% of the variability in tacrolimus dose requirements among subjects, confirming previous research findings and highlighting its importance in tailoring tacrolimus therapy to optimize outcomes in organ transplant recipients.
title: Effects of Last Dosing Time on Population Pharmacokinetic Analysis of Tacrolimus Performed using Extracted Data from Electronic Health Records

finding: The CC genotype of rs1617640 (promoter) was found to be associated with anemia using an additive inheritance model, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.96 (p-value 0.04). This association connected the genotype to lower hemoglobin levels and increased inflammation (as indicated by elevated NLR), suggesting that this SNP affects EPO plasma levels directly and is implicated in anemia.
title: Erythropoietin single nucleotide polymorphisms are associated with anemia and dyslipidemia in a cardiovascular disease population

finding: The GG genotype of rs507392 (intron) demonstrated protective effects against dyslipidemia in a recessive model, evident with an OR of 0.29 (p-value 0.048). This SNP was associated with lower EPO levels in plasma but higher levels of total cholesterol and LDL. Furthermore, the G allele was also linked to hypertension exclusively in females, highlighting a sex-dependent risk.
title: Erythropoietin single nucleotide polymorphisms are associated with anemia and dyslipidemia in a cardiovascular disease population

finding: The study identified a significant association between the IL-6 rs1800795 variant (174 G>C) and metabolic risk factors such as waist-hip-ratio (WHR) and insulin resistance (IR) in North Indian adult women. The obese group (WHR >0.85) exhibited higher frequencies of the mutant genotype GC+CC (89.19%) and the mutant allele C (75.68%). It was concluded that the IL-6 polymorphism was correlated with elevated levels of key metabolic indices including HOMA-IR, triglycerides (TG), and total cholesterol (TC), all showing significant p values (<0.05). This indicated that the IL-6 rs1800795 variant plays an important role in contributing to obesity-related metabolic disorders.
title: Association of Interleukin-6 gene (rs1800795) variant with waist-hip-ratio and Insulin resistance: A cross sectional study in adult women

finding: SNP rs10807797, found in a region rich in genes including ABCB5, was significant across various populations, suggesting a broad influence on neurological resilience post-stroke.
title: Multi-ancestry genetic study in 5,876 patients identifies an association between excitotoxic genes and early outcomes after acute ischemic stroke

finding: The rs1990622 variant was reported at the TMEM106B locus, supporting the role of lysosomal dysfunction in FTLD-TDP. This signal came from the first FTLD-TDP genome-wide association study which included GRN mutation carriers.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The rs10281425 variant was associated with the TMEM106B risk haplotype, influencing mRNA expression and believed to impact lysosomal function in FTLD-TDP.
title: Deciphering Distinct Genetic Risk Factors for FTLD-TDP Pathological Subtypes via Whole-Genome Sequencing

finding: The SNP rs55985730 had a PIP of 0.91 but was noted for having the nearest gene OPN1SW, which is not relevant to Atrial Fibrillation. Instead, it was implicated in looping to CALU, a risk gene involved in alleviating endoplasmic reticulum stress in cardiomyocytes. This signifies the importance of considering chromatin interactions for identifying true risk genes.
title: Single-cell genomics improves the discovery of risk variants and genes of Atrial Fibrillation

finding: The study identified a significant association between the IL-6-174 G/C polymorphism (rs1800795) and polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS). The mutant 'C' allele was more prevalent in women with PCOS compared to the control group, with a p-value less than 0.0001 and an odds ratio of 1.91. This suggested a strong correlation with metabolic risk factors, such as higher waist-to-hip ratio (WHR), HOMA index, and serum IL-6 levels among PCOS patients, indicating that the CC genotype was linked to increased risk of developing metabolic syndrome. Specifically, PCOS women with homozygous CC and heterozygous GC genotypes had significantly higher metabolic risk indicators than those without PCOS.
title: Interleukin-6 -174 G/C promoter gene polymorphism and polycystic ovary syndrome: A cross sectional investigation in adult women

finding: The variant rs748670681 at 7p22.1 was associated with the ring finger protein 216 (RNF216), a regulator of the NF-κB signaling pathway. This novel finding linked RNF216 to psoriasis risk and had not been reported in previous studies.
title: Genetic study of psoriasis highlights its close link with socio-economic status and affective symptoms

finding: The study provided strong evidence that carriers of the missense variant rs774055408, located in the leptin gene (LEP), exhibited a significant association with circulating leptin levels in adulthood. This association was found to be highly statistically significant with a P value of 6.2×10^-12, reinforcing the validity of the genetic instrument for examining the relationship between adiposity and leptin levels in further analyses.
title: Time-varying and tissue-dependent effects of adiposity on leptin levels: a Mendelian randomization study

finding: This SNP was associated with several molecular phenotypes, particularly in a network that linked genetic regulation of the resistin gene (RETN) to low-density lipoprotein (LDL) levels and cardiovascular disease. It was found to regulate 67 other genes and was involved in trans relations with GRB10 and IKZF1.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: This SNP was identified to regulate two proteins, PILRB and PILRA, both showing the same direction of effect, highlighting its role in shared genetic regulatory networks.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: This SNP was shown to regulate both expression and protein levels of IL-6, alongside a trans-pQTL interaction with the IL-6 receptor gene, depicting a shared genetic regulation contributing to inflammatory responses.
title: Genetic analysis of blood molecular phenotypes reveals regulatory networks affecting complex traits: a DIRECT study

finding: The rs4947534 variant in PSPH indicated a potential positive effect on offspring birthweight, linked to serine metabolism.
title: Causal effects of maternal circulating amino acids on offspring birthweight: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The rs11556924 SNP is an exonic non-synonymous variant located within the ZC3HC1 gene, identified with a high CADD score of 28, which suggests its potential deleterious impact. This variation's association with telomere length and cardiovascular diseases indicates its relevance in the study of genetic influences on these conditions.
title: Contribution of leukocyte telomere length to major cardiovascular diseases onset: phenotypic and genetic insights from a large-scale genome-wide cross-trait analysis

finding: The variant rs139729994 (3600G>A) was identified as one of the four CF-causing variants within the CFTR gene. It was reported to have originated approximately 270 generations ago, which translates to around 6,750 years.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The variant rs193922500 (V456A) was one of the four CF-causing variants in the study and was dated to have emerged roughly 215 generations ago, equating to about 5,300 years.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The variant rs76713772 (1717-1G>A) was recognized as a CF-causing variant. It was revealed to be the youngest variant amongst the four analyzed, having originated approximately 425 generations ago, which is about 10,600 years.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The variant rs77646904 (V520F) was found to be a CF-causing variant prevalent specifically in East Asian populations. It was dated to have appeared around 338 generations ago, roughly 8,450 years.
title: Diversity of CFTR variants across ancestries characterized using 454,727 UK biobank whole exome sequences

finding: The rs6945340/HIP1 variant was associated with the largest number of enriched pathways (n=391 across all tissues), particularly in the heart left ventricle, highlighting pathways relevant to heart failure such as the Krebs cycle and oxidative phosphorylation.
title: Genome-wide association analysis and Mendelian randomization proteomics identify novel protein biomarkers and drug targets for primary prevention of heart failure

finding: The hypertension-associated SNP rs3735533 within the HOTTIP long non-coding RNA had a lower odds ratio in the top quartile of cardiovascular disease topic weight (1.07±0.02) compared to the bottom quartile (1.13±0.02). This suggested that the genetic risk related to hypertension may differ based on cardiovascular comorbidity weight.
title: Age-dependent topic modelling of comorbidities in UK Biobank identifies disease subtypes with differential genetic risk

finding: This SNP in the CTLA4 gene was significantly associated with lower risk of autoimmune diseases like Type 1 diabetes but had a higher risk of basal cell carcinoma.
title: Extensive antagonistic variants across human genome

finding: This variant was classified as pathogenic and associated with a congenital disorder related to glycosylation, indicating potential implications for cardiac health.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: This SNP was noted for negative associations with Bechet’s disease in the Han Chinese population, suggesting its relevance in inflammatory disease research.
title: VAREANT: a bioinformatics application for gene variant reduction and annotation

finding: The SNP rs7384878 prioritized the gene CUX1, which could imply its involvement in Alzheimer's pathogenesis.
title: Single-cell RNA sequencing data reveals rewiring of transcriptional relationships in Alzheimer’s Disease associated with risk variants

finding: The SNP was associated with eosinophil count, with a positive suppressing interaction with rs112610805. This finding replicated in additional cohorts and highlighted the roles of CCL24 and CCL26 chemokine levels.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: Similar to rs10281069, this SNP displayed a positive suppressing interaction in eosinophil counts and levels of CCL24 and CCL26, indicating their potential roles in eosinophil biology.
title: Variance quantitative trait loci reveal gene-gene interactions which alter blood traits

finding: The SNP rs13234970 was linked to appetite changes and identified as the nearest gene to TMEM106B in relation to this PHQ-9 symptom. This SNP's association reinforced previous findings regarding the genetic contribution of TMEM106B to various depression symptoms, establishing a meaningful genetic connection between appetite changes and other depressive contexts.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs3807866 was associated with depressed mood and was also linked to the gene TMEM106B, like rs13234970. Its identification in the GWAS underlined the significance of TMEM106B in the etiology of depression, providing insight into the gene's role in multiple depressive symptomatologies.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: Identified as the top variant correlating with the sum score of the PHQ-9, the SNP rs12699338 was closely related to TMEM106B. Its association highlighted the gene's implications in a broader spectrum of depression symptoms, affirming its relevance in the genetic landscape of depressive disorders.
title: Investigating the genetic relationship between depression symptoms and Alzheimer’s Disease in clinically diagnosed and proxy cases

finding: The SNP rs157934 was significantly associated with insulin-like growth factor 1 (IGF-1) levels, showing a very strong association with a p-value of 2 × 10^-109, indicating a potential role in metabolic processes relevant to overall health.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs13234269 exhibited a strong genetic association with high-density lipoprotein cholesterol levels, with a p-value of 5 × 10^-102, which suggests its implication in lipid metabolism and cardiovascular health.
title: Unraveling COVID-19 Relationship with Anxiety Disorders and Symptoms

finding: The SNP rs62465482 is near ASL, identified as a superior biomarker for liver disease and highlighted in fine mapping to have a high causal probability for liver traits.
title: Genome-wide association study of liver fat, iron, and extracellular fluid fraction in the UK Biobank

finding: This SNP was replicated in the meta-analysis involving additional GWAS datasets for age-related ocular disorders, confirming its association and contribution to the diseases.
title: Genome-wide analysis of genetic pleiotropy and causal genes across three age-related ocular disorders

finding: The SNP rs63750695 was detected in five patients with ESCC, all of whom were African, indicating a potential association with African ethnicity in relation to esophageal cancer susceptibility.
title: Comprehensive Study of Germline Mutations and Double-Hit Events in Esophageal Squamous Cell Cancer

finding: The variant rs2897075-T associated with IPF, highlighting its relevance in pulmonary genetic architecture and implications for COVID-19 severity.
title: Integration of GWAS and multi-omic QTLs identifies uncharacterized COVID-19 gene-biotype and phenotype associations

finding: The rare SNP rs569607645, located within the transmembrane helices region of the CRHR2 gene, was found to convert a hydrophobic amino acid (glycine) to a hydrophilic one (arginine). This change, located in a cholesterol-binding motif, was implicated in impairing CRHR2 functions, suggesting a potential decrease in coping mechanisms related to stress and food suppression in individuals with eating disorders.
title: Rare CRHR2 and GRM8 variants identified as candidate factors associated with eating disorders in Japanese patients

finding: The SNP rs62474683 emerged as the index SNP most highly associated with SA in an intergenic region on chromosome 7. It displayed an odds ratio (OR) of 1.06 with statistical significance (P=1.91×10^-10). This SNP's effect remained genome-wide significant after conditioning on major depressive disorder (MDD) and showed notable associations with risk-taking behaviors and smoking.
title: Dissecting the shared genetic architecture of suicide attempt, psychiatric disorders and known risk factors

finding: The SNP rs113993960 is a known pathogenic variant (Phe508del) for cystic fibrosis and was confidently associated with COPD but not with smoking, marking its significance in respiratory disease genetics.
title: Multi-trait and multi-ancestry genetic analysis of comorbid lung diseases and traits improves genetic discovery and polygenic risk prediction

finding: The MLXIPL variant rs17145750 showed a significant finding associated with early childhood BMI development, with different effects noted in adult studies.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The SNP rs287621, located upstream of KLF14, was associated with BMI in infancy, showing a peak at six months before declining, and indicated a maternal imprinting effect.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity
