finding: The variant rs12672489 upstream of KLF14 associated with early childhood BMI but did not maintain associations into adulthood, indicating specific childhood growth influences.
title: Characterization of the genetic architecture of BMI in infancy and early childhood reveals age-specific effects and implicates pathways involved in Mendelian obesity

finding: The SNP rs34291892 exhibited a significant association with neck or shoulder pain, with a p-value of 1.69 x 10^-9, located in the FOXP2 gene on chromosome 7. Previous studies had confirmed its association with pain phenotypes, linking it to neurological functions.
title: A Genome-wide Association Study Identifies Novel Genetic Variants Associated with Neck or Shoulder Pain in the UK Biobank (N = 441,757)

finding: The study revealed that <italic>GPNMB</italic> rs199347 significantly modified the activity of the sensorimotor network in Parkinson's disease (PD) patients, with an adjusted <italic>p</italic> value of less than 0.0007 after correcting for false discovery rate (FDR). This SNP was found to enhance global efficiency and nodal network metrics in the bilateral caudate without affecting structural network metrics, suggesting its significant role in functional brain networks related to PD.
title: The multi-modality neuroimaging analysis identified an essential genetic variant associated with Parkinson’s disease

finding: It was identified that rs189299852 significantly drove the causal inference of the myeloid DC SSC-A parameter, marking it as important in immune profiling.
title: Causal effect of the gut microbiota on the risk of psychiatric disorders and the mediating role of immunophenotypes

finding: The LOC401312-LOC541472 locus's association was linked to copper level regulation.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP3A7-CYP3A51P locus confirmed its association with estrone levels, providing evidence for hormonal regulation.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The associated SNP revealed connections between different amino acid metabolites.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The CYP3A5 locus association suggested its involvement in a range of metabolic pathways.
title: Multi-trait genome-wide association study in 34,394 Chinese women reveals the genetic architecture of plasma metabolites during pregnancy

finding: The variant rs2891691 was associated with a two-fold increased odds of developing type 2 diabetes, with a minor allele frequency of 1.7% in Latino populations. In sex-specific analyses, the association was notably stronger in women (OR=2.4), compared to men (OR=1.5). The variant was located between the ORC5 and LHFPL3 genes and demonstrated significant findings in both discovery and replication cohorts.
title: The power of TOPMed imputation for the discovery of Latino enriched rare variants associated with type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs12673181, located upstream of the GRM3 gene on chromosome 7, was newly identified as significantly associated with lifetime cannabis use with a p-value of 6.90E-09. This association marked a novel finding as no prior links between GRM3 variants and cannabis-related traits had been established. GRM3 encodes an inhibitory receptor that plays roles in glutamate neurotransmission and has been implicated in other substance use contexts.
title: Genome-wide association studies of lifetime and frequency cannabis use in 131,895 individuals

finding: The study identified that the IRF5 TCTA haplotype, which includes rs2004640, was associated with an increased risk of mortality from COVID-19 in European-American subjects, especially significant in the younger age group.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Similar to rs2004640, the IRF5 TCTA haplotype containing rs3807306 was found to increase the risk of mortality from COVID-19 in European-Americans, with risk particularly pronounced in those aged 45-54.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: As a component of the IRF5 TCTA haplotype, rs10488631 was shown to correlate with increased mortality risk from COVID-19 in European-American patients, reinforcing the role of the interferon pathway.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: Alongside the other IRF5 SNPs in the haplotype, rs2280714 was associated with higher COVID-19 mortality risk in European-Americans, particularly in younger cohorts.
title: Interferon pathway lupus risk alleles modulate risk of death from acute COVID-19

finding: The rs680055 variant, corresponding to the CYP3A43 gene, was noted for being an African specific variant distribution across populations, indicating its unique relevance in pharmacogenomics for therapeutics targeting African populations.
title: AI coupled to pharmacometric modelling to tailor malaria and tuberculosis treatment in Africa

finding: SNP rs2302634 showed strong association with the injury/inflammation component (PC3), with the T allele predicting higher scores (+0.26SD). This SNP's effects were more significant in males, contributing to AD risk.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: The SNP was strongly associated with non-AD inflammation in males (-1.20SD), but the association was not present in females, indicating a potential male-specific genetic effect.
title: Multivariate GWAS of Alzheimer’s disease CSF biomarker profiles implies GRIN2D in synaptic functioning

finding: This variant associated with CD36 was confirmed for its involvement in higher RDW within African ancestry populations.
title: Whole genome sequencing association analysis of quantitative red blood cell phenotypes: the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: This SNP was associated with ascending aortic distensibility and was found 12.6 kilobases upstream of the elastin gene (ELN), which is crucial for the structural integrity of blood vessels.
title: GENOME-WIDE ASSOCIATIONS OF AORTIC DISTENSIBILITY SUGGEST CAUSAL RELATIONSHIPS WITH AORTIC ANEURYSMS AND BRAIN WHITE MATTER HYPERINTENSITIES

finding: The variant rs12531645 showed widespread metabolic associations, including significant positive associations with VLDL, triglyceride levels, and fatty acid measures.
title: Exploring metabolic changes in gout – Insights from a genetic study

finding: The SNP rs58120505, an intronic variant within the MAD1L1 gene, was also identified as a candidate effector gene residing within proximity to SCZ risk loci. Its presence was linked to the immune mechanism in the context of schizophrenia.
title: A transcriptome-wide Mendelian randomization study in isolated human immune cells highlights interferon regulatory transcription factor 3 as a schizophrenia hub gene

finding: This SNP was linked to multiple metabolites also involving steroids and bile acids. It was notably associated with metabolic processes related to breast cancer and atorvastatin metabolism, suggesting that it plays a role in metabolic regulation influencing these health parameters.
title: Genome-wide Association Studies of Missing Metabolite Measures: Results From Two Population-based Studies

finding: The SNP rs858275 was identified as being significantly associated with the protein GPNMB levels in cerebrospinal fluid (CSF), which is critical in Parkinson's disease. This finding indicated that the levels of the GPNMB protein, which were previously reported to be upregulated in the substantia nigra of Parkinson's disease patients, were influenced by this cis-SNP. The study's results connected this genetic variant to its potential role in the pathogenesis of Parkinson's disease, contributing to insights into therapeutic targeting.
title: Parkinson’s disease causality and heterogeneity: a proteogenomic view

finding: This SNP was identified as the most activated SNP in the GLN-model for classifying individuals with atrial fibrillation (AF). It is classified as an intron variant in the CAV1 gene, which plays a critical role in the structure of caveolae in plasma membranes and is implicated as a tumor suppressor. Its association with AF was noted across various population studies.
title: An assessment of the value of deep neural networks in genetic risk prediction for surgically relevant outcomes

finding: Lastly, the study characterized a stop-gain variant eQTL for CD36 (rs3211938) that colocalized with alkaline phosphatase levels, with a frequency of 11.5% in 1000 Genomes Africans and a perfect colocalization probability of PP4 = 1.00.
title: A Southern African Map of Blood Regulatory Variation Enables GWAS Interpretation

finding: The SNP rs17160467 near BCL9 was part of findings that support the role of Wnt/β-catenin signaling in the pathogenesis of COPD.
title: Leveraging deep-learning on raw spirograms to improve genetic understanding and risk scoring of COPD despite noisy labels

finding: This new locus at 7q32.2-TMEM209 was uniquely associated with TET2-CH, reinforcing the specificity of TET2 mutation impacts on clonal hematopoiesis.
title: Genome-wide analyses of 200,453 individuals yields new insights into the causes and consequences of clonal hematopoiesis

finding: Association with SCC was noted for the variant rs111754768 in THSD7A on 7p21.3, which is implicated in disease susceptibility, notably coronary artery disease.
title: Trans-ethnic genome-wide meta-analysis of 35,732 cases and 34,424 controls identifies novel genomic cross-ancestry loci contributing to lung cancer susceptibility

finding: This SNP, located in the LFNG gene, was associated with gastrointestinal disorders including IBS and kidney stones. It demonstrated associations with higher risks of IBS and obesity, indicating its relevance in gastrointestinal health.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of diarrhea during acute SARS-CoV2 infection identifies multiple novel loci and contrasting etiological roles of irritable bowel syndrome subtypes

finding: The variant rs574674363 was associated with lower levels of high-density lipoprotein (HDL) cholesterol, supporting findings in the context of metabolic health.
title: Diversity and Scale: Genetic Architecture of 2,068 Traits in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: This SNP was strongly associated (P-value 6.1E-06) with general cognition in a meta analysis and showed nominal associations across all GWASs of related traits.
title: Genetic Variations in Evolutionary Accelerated Regions Disrupt Cognition in Schizophrenia

finding: The SNP rs2896218 was found to have a significant protective association with strabismus, esotropia, and exotropia under the dominant model. Its protective association was also maintained when adjusted for age and gender, suggesting its potential role in the genetic basis of strabismus.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The SNP rs2285544 exhibited a significant protective association with both esotropia and exotropia under the dominant model. This association was also significant after adjusting for age and gender, marking it as a relevant genetic marker in strabismus.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The SNP rs4730775 was significantly associated with exotropia and showed a significant risk association under both the dominant and additive models. This highlights its potential involvement in the etiology of strabismus subtypes.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: The SNP rs3840660 showed a significant risk association with exotropia under the dominant model, particularly when adjusted for age and gender, indicating its potential relevance in genetic predisposition to strabismus.
title: Exploring WNT2 Polymorphisms in Comitant Strabismus: A Genetic Association Study

finding: In the GWAS conducted on PE risk, the lead SNP rs1424597 at the PLXNA4 locus exhibited a strong association with increased risk of pulmonary embolism (PE), particularly in patients aged over 37 years (OR = 1.74, p = 5.42×10^-4). The minor A allele was associated with increased odds of PE in the MARTHA study and was similarly observed in the EOVT study, indicating PLXNA4 as a novel susceptibility gene for PE.
title: An artificial neural network approach integrating plasma proteomics and genetic data identifies PLXNA4 as a new susceptibility locus for pulmonary embolism

finding: The rs113993960 variant in CFTR was identified as leading to the deletion of a crucial F508 residue of the CFTR protein. It was present at a high frequency in the dataset with an allele frequency (AF) of 0.0052, confirming previous studies and validating the constructed allele frequency reference.
title: Expanding the Russian allele frequency reference via cross-laboratory data integration: insights from 6,096 exome samples

finding: In this research, GPNMB rs199347 GG carriers demonstrated higher GM-Fun, WM-Fun, and GM-WM node coupling compared to AA carriers and AG carriers, suggesting that the G allele is protective against PD by enhancing structural-functional node coupling in affected individuals.
title: Altered structural-functional coupling in Parkinson’s disease

finding: EPHA1:rs11762262-A was associated with a protective effect, reinforcing its role in the genetics of AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: RELN:rs201731543-C showed resilient properties, enhancing knowledge about protective genomic factors concerning AD.
title: Biobank-scale characterization of Alzheimer’s disease and related dementias identifies potential disease-causing variants, risk factors, and genetic modifiers across diverse ancestries

finding: In the context of the TWIST1 CAD locus, rs2107595 was identified by CAFEH as a dominant component contributing to the CAD GWAS, showing significant regulatory effects on TWIST1 expression specifically in artery tissue, validated by CRISPR studies.
title: Redefining tissue specificity of genetic regulation of gene expression in the presence of allelic heterogeneity

finding: The rs2533629 SNP was confirmed as a regulatory variant linked to schizophrenia, with a G to A change increasing binding affinity for FOXC2 and showing higher delta repression scores in CNS biosamples.
title: The contribution of silencer variants to human diseases

finding: The study indicated that rs1045642 (ABCB1 3435T>C) was associated with significantly higher verapamil AUCs in individuals homozygous for the CC allele compared to TT and TC individuals, suggesting that this SNP was a key driver in the metabolism of verapamil.
title: A dose-finding study to guide use of verapamil as an adjunctive therapy in tuberculosis

finding: SNP rs2066992, associated with the IL6 gene, indicated involvement in immune responses, linking it to C4 protein concentration and inflammation processes.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of neonatal Complement Component 3 and 4 protein concentrations with a focus on psychiatric and autoimmune disorders

finding: The rs1045642 SNP in the ABCB1 gene was recognized for its association with altered expression of P-glycoprotein, directly affecting drug pharmacokinetics. It was highlighted that individuals with the homozygous TT genotype have a more than threefold increased risk of developing DILI, emphasizing its clinical relevance in TB treatment.
title: Polymorphism of NAT2, PXR, ABCB1, and GSTT1 genes among tuberculosis patients of North Eastern States of India

finding: In the AMR population, rs7801770 showed significant association at p=2.21×10−9 with CHRM2, indicating its potential involvement in neural mechanisms relevant to visual processing.
title: Genomewide association study of epiretinal membrane: discovery of significant risk loci in each of three American populations

finding: SNP rs3812316 near MLXIPL was strongly associated with triglyceride levels and showed an implication in the conversion of free to esterified cholesterol in LDL particles.
title: Lipoprotein profile and metabolic fine-mapping of genetic lipid risk loci

finding: SNP rs55986907 was part of super-variant chr7_23, suggesting mitochondrial interactions that might influence COVID-19 severity through gene TOMM7.
title: Genetic variants are identified to increase risk of COVID-19 related mortality from UK Biobank data

finding: The SNP rs4729607 was associated with HGB/HCT traits and was in near perfect linkage disequilibrium with a deletion on chromosome 7 that includes the EPO promoter. This deletion was thought to modulate gene expression, impacting iron metabolism and erythropoiesis by altering the expression levels of nearby genes.
title: Whole genome sequencing identifies common and rare structural variants contributing to hematologic traits in the NHLBI TOPMed program

finding: The variant rs74504435 had a high posterior probability (0.946) indicating it was specifically associated with EGFR expression in astrocytes. This genetic regulatory signal in astrocytes also colocalized with risk for Alzheimer's disease (AD), emphasizing the cell type-specific role of this variant in the disease biology.
title: Single-Nucleus Atlas of Cell-Type Specific Genetic Regulation in the Human Brain

finding: This SNP was associated with ascending aorta minimum area (DAo min area) and showed colocalization with systolic blood pressure, indicating a connection to cardiovascular traits.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: This SNP was associated with reading disability, linking cognitive function with genetic influences on cardiovascular health.
title: Heart-brain connections: phenotypic and genetic insights from 40,000 cardiac and brain magnetic resonance images

finding: For rs7384878, significant associations with LOAD were evident in both UKB and ADNI, with mediation effects observed where this SNP affected the volume of the putamen and was related to structural changes in the superior parietal cortex.
title: Brain morphology mediating the effect of genetic risk variants on Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The AUTS2 variant rs3735260 was linked to increased volume in the optic radiation near the primary visual cortex, with a notable effect observed in the right hemisphere.
title: Distinct impact modes of polygenic disposition to dyslexia in the adult brain

finding: The SNP rs1476535 was revealed as a shared causal variant with PTSD in multiple contexts, specifically relating to mechanisms underlying various cardiovascular outcomes.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs8180817 was acknowledged in the context of shared risk loci for PTSD, indicating its functional relevance across the investigated phenotypes.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs2470937 was characterized in the study as a shared causal variant between PTSD and cardiovascular phenotypes in the colocalization analysis.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs34809719 had been identified as a shared event with PTSD in multiple networks, linking it to various cardiovascular and behavioral traits.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs13237518 was recognized as a shared SNP between PTSD and cardiovascular traits, highlighting its role in the overlapping genetic architecture.
title: Genetics of posttraumatic stress disorder and cardiovascular conditions using Life’s Essential 8, Electronic Health Records, and Heart Imaging

finding: The SNP rs10270358 was associated with seeing a doctor for anxiety or depression, as well as chronic disability/infirmity, both of which could potentially reduce wellbeing. This original finding was significant in the context of exploring the genetic liability to having children and its effects on parental wellbeing.
title: Exploring the lifetime effect of children on wellbeing using two-sample Mendelian randomisation

finding: SNP rs1045642 showed an alternate G allele frequency of approximately 60% in the Japanese population. In this study, three of the five participants presented with the G allele, confirming existing data and demonstrating its potential influence on anesthetic outcomes.
title: Rapid detection of single nucleotide polymorphisms using the MinION nanopore sequencer: a feasibility study for perioperative precision medicine

finding: The SNP rs115325598 located at the intron region of gene ATXN7L1 was discovered to be significantly associated with acne severity among individuals with African ancestry in the BioVU cohort (P-value = 3.15 x 10^-8). This finding suggested a strong genetic influence on disease severity in this subset, with the effect allele (C) showing a frequency of 16% among severe cases compared to 6% in controls.
title: Genome-wide association study analysis of disease severity in Acne reveals novel biological insights

finding: The SNP rs42044 in the CDK6 gene was confirmed as significant in the GWA analyses for body mass index (BMI) and neutrophil cell count.
title: Critically ill COVID-19 associated trait genetics reveals CDK6 inhibitors as potential treatment

finding: The lead SNP rs10230978 was linked to elevated expression of the IKZF1 gene, which has been associated with protection against ovarian cancer while simultaneously increasing the risk for type 1 diabetes, demonstrating opposite effects on cancer and autoimmune disease.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: The rs10240978-A allele exhibited protective effects against ovarian cancer but was associated with an increased risk of autoimmune diseases like type 1 diabetes, reinforcing the duality of genetic influence in cancer and immune-related conditions.
title: Mapping inherited genetic variation with opposite effects on autoimmune disease and cancer identifies candidate drug targets associated with the anti-tumor immune response

finding: This is a Japanese-enriched missense variant linked to platelet glycoprotein IV deficiency.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: A Finnish-enriched variant linked to inflammatory bowel disease and psoriasis within an intron of <italic>TNRC18</italic>.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Confirmed as a height variant in BBJ but not in FinnGen or UKBB.
title: Insights from complex trait fine-mapping across diverse populations

finding: Associated with PS thickening, this SNP presented an intriguing aspect of AMD risk, suggesting its potential role in thickening of the retinal layer.
title: Photoreceptor layer thinning is an early biomarker for age-related macular degeneration development: Epidemiological and genetic evidence from UK Biobank optical coherence tomography data

finding: The variant rs201498350, located in the gene ABCB4 as c.2784-12T>C, was investigated in the context of liver disease. It was linked to severe liver disease in a multi-ethnic population, particularly within the Puerto Rican community, where it displayed a carrier rate of approximately 1.95%. In vitro analyses confirmed that this non-coding variant disrupted splicing of the ABCB4 pre-mRNA, leading to a protein product lacking exon 23 and thus likely non-functional. Manual chart reviews indicated advanced liver disease in four of five homozygous carriers of the variant, while heterozygotes were also associated with an increased risk of liver disease. The findings established a correlation between the variant and increased liver disease risk in an allele dose-dependent manner.
title: Leveraging Health Systems Data to Characterize a Large Effect Variant Conferring Risk for Liver Disease in Puerto Ricans

finding: The SNP rs12535226 was identified as a novel risk locus associated with LOAD. It was found within the first intron of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) gene and showed evidence of having a regulatory role. It was associated with LOAD risk after false-discovery rate correction, alongside known LOAD risk loci, and had a minor allele frequency of 48% in European-ancestry populations.
title: An integrated genome and phenome-wide association study approach to understanding Alzheimer’s disease predisposition

finding: The SNP rs4727512 was associated with a higher frequency of idiopathic cases in patients. Females carrying high-risk genotypes (HRG) at this SNP were more frequently idiopathic compared to those with lower-risk genotypes (LRG), with approximately 28% of females categorized as idiopathic versus 18% of males.
title: Role of common and rare genetic variants in the aetiology of trigeminal neuralgia

finding: The presence of the alternate allele of this variant in ADAM22 was linked to significantly shorter transcript lengths, potentially affecting TNFα release and thus improving the response to BIRB796 treatment.
title: Combining explainable machine learning, demographic and multi-omic data to identify precision medicine strategies for inflammatory bowel disease

finding: The SNP rs62474683 was identified as associated with suicide attempts (SA) through a large-scale meta-analysis involving approximately 30,000 SA cases and over 500,000 controls. Its significance was maintained even after accounting for GWAS results related to depression.
title: Clinical, genomic, and neurophysiological correlates of lifetime suicide attempts among individuals with alcohol dependence

finding: SNP rs149721630 was identified as an intronic variant within the ABCA13 gene, which is part of the ATP-binding cassette (ABC) family involved in transmembrane transport. This SNP was associated with asthma exacerbations and had been related to decreased expression levels in the lungs that could correlate with increased asthma severity. It also suggested a potential link between lipid transport, inflammation, and asthma through its effects on this genetic region.
title: Asthma exacerbations and eosinophilia in the UK Biobank: a Genome-Wide Association Study

finding: The SNP rs7807369 was identified as significantly associated with an increased risk of high on-treatment platelet reactivity (HTPR) in African Americans, with a p-value of 4.56 x 10^-9. The odds ratio for this association was reported as 9.11, indicating a strong link to clopidogrel resistance.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: rs1149515 was validated in the MVP cohort and shown to be associated with an elevated risk of major adverse cardiac events (MACE) among homozygous C allele carriers, presenting an odds ratio of 1.85 with a p-value of 6.21 x 10^-6.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs7792678 was associated with a higher expression of THSD7A in endothelial cells, and genome-wide association studies indicated a potential risk factor for HTPR, with the frequency of the effect allele being notably higher in African Americans compared to Europeans.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: SNP rs7811849 was found to be in high linkage disequilibrium with rs7807369 and was implicated in the expression regulation of THSD7A, further supporting the association of THSD7A with clopidogrel resistance.
title: Investigation of genomic and transcriptomic risk factors in clopidogrel response in African Americans

finding: The SNP rs6466488 on chromosome 7 was identified as one of the top associations for short sleep duration in the EUR population and related to the FOXP2 gene linked to various neuropsychiatric traits.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: Located near MAD1L1 on chromosome 7, the SNP rs111595851 showed a strong association with short sleep duration and is connected to multiple psychiatric traits.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs1989903 on chromosome 7 was identified as a significant association for short sleep duration, indicating its role near the FOXP2 gene.
title: Genome-wide association study investigating short and long sleep duration: a cross-population meta-analysis

finding: The SNP rs34896991 was identified as a missense variant in the SAMD9 gene associated with reduced 28-day survival in sepsis patients. Specifically, it was reported to have a hazard ratio of 1.64, indicating a significant association with increased mortality risk in this context.
title: A Genome-Wide Association Study of Survival in Patients with Sepsis

finding: The SNP rs67250450 was indicated to have significance and was mentioned regarding its association with Alzheimer's disease.
title: Multi-ancestry meta-analysis and fine-mapping in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: This variant was connected with TMEM106B, showcasing its association with protein traits in multiple contexts.
title: Ancestrally diverse genome-wide association analysis highlights ancestry-specific differences in genetic regulation of plasma protein levels

finding: This SNP was associated with decreased modified Tiffeneau-Pinelli index and had a reported association with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) at the C1GALT1 locus, indicating its role in modulating O-glycosylation traits.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: This SNP acted as a positive regulator of C1GALT1 expression and was significantly associated with higher serum levels of galactosylated IgA O-glycans, which are relevant in the context of IgA nephropathy.
title: The genetics and epidemiology of N- and O- IgA glycomics

finding: The synonymous SNV on PILRA (rs2405442) showed exome-wide significance in the AD-age score linear regression and was suggestive in the Cox regression but did not reach the suggestive threshold in logistic regression, highlighting its potential role in AD.
title: A novel age-informed approach for genetic association analysis in Alzheimer’s disease

finding: Located in the FOXP2 gene on chromosome 7, this SNP demonstrated a significant association with both ADHD-CUD and ADHD, with an odds ratio (OR) of 1.05 and a p-value of 6.67×10^-16, indicating its relevance to both disorders.
title: Disentangling the shared genetics of ADHD, cannabis use disorder and cannabis use and prediction of cannabis use disorder in ADHD

finding: The SNP rs38904 was implicated in ulcerative colitis (UC) through the expression analysis of the CFTR gene in secretory TA precursor cells and intestinal stromal cells. The downregulation of the CFTR gene was noted to potentially have a protective effect, aligning with recent observations that loss-of-function mutations in CFTR confer protection against Crohn's Disease (CD).
title: Integrated cell type-specific analysis of blood and gut identifies matching eQTL for 140 IBD risk loci and entrectinib as possible repurposing candidate

finding: The eQTL rs11976145 associated with TBX20 was shown to colocalize with a CAD GWAS signal. Although it exhibited no associations in GTEx arterial tissues, it was recognized as a significant regulator in cardiac development, suggesting its complexity in transcription regulation relevant to CAD.
title: Integrative multi-ancestry genetic analysis of gene regulation in coronary arteries prioritizes disease risk loci

finding: The genetic variant rs13237518 in TMEM106B showed a significant effect on IS thickness across macular fields, with a different impact between foveal and peripheral fields, relevant to frontotemporal lobar degeneration.
title: Sub-cellular level resolution of common genetic variation in the photoreceptor layer identifies continuum between rare disease and common variation

finding: The minor allele of TMEM106B rs1990622 was associated with a decreased risk of developing Frontotemporal Dementia (FTD), particularly in GRN mutation carriers. This association suggested that the minor allele conferred a protective effect, linked to greater gray matter volume in the thalamus of presymptomatic GRN mutation carriers. Additionally, the minor allele was associated with greater cognitive scores among all C9orf72 mutation carriers and presymptomatic C9orf72 mutation carriers under a recessive dosage model, indicating it may enhance cognitive resilience in these groups.
title: Gene specific effects on brain volume and cognition of TMEM106B in frontotemporal lobar degeneration

finding: This SNP was identified as a trans-ancestry variant associated with lower testosterone levels in African and Hispanic ancestry groups, but it was associated with higher testosterone levels in the European ancestry group.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: Located on chromosome 7, this SNP near the BAIAP2L1 gene was significantly associated with lower odds of prostate cancer in the European ancestry group.
title: Discovery of Novel Trans-Ancestry and Ancestry-Specific Gene Loci for Total Testosterone in a Multi-Ancestral Analysis of Men in the Million Veteran Program

finding: The SNP rs41301394 was identified as a novel genome-wide significant locus for the clozapine:norclozapine metabolic ratio, located within the gene POR. It exhibited a high posterior probability of being the causal variant (PPI=0.437). This finding was significant as it linked rs41301394 to pharmacogenomic variation in warfarin maintenance doses in East Asians, although it had only preliminary levels of evidence previously.
title: Pharmacokinetics and pharmacogenomics of clozapine in an ancestrally diverse sample: A longitudinal analysis and GWAS using clinical monitoring data from the UK

finding: The intergenic variant rs939955, located between CYP3A4 and CYP3A7, was associated with triglyceride levels, with a p-value of 2.47 × 10^-9 and a corresponding p-value in BBJ of 1.2 × 10^-4. This variant exhibited a minor allele frequency of 0.22 in KoGES but was rare in Europeans, emphasizing ethnic differences in genetic associations.
title: Genome-wide study on 72,298 Korean individuals in Korean biobank data for 76 traits identifies hundreds of novel loci

finding: The SNP rs2267735 in the ADCYAP1R1 gene was associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms in a meta-analysis conducted by Lind et al. in 2017. Additionally, a longitudinal analysis by Zhang et al. in 2022 indicated that this SNP exhibited both a main effect and interaction effect with environmental factors on the trajectory of PTSD symptoms. These studies suggest that rs2267735 may influence the susceptibility and progression of PTSD, linking the genetic variation to clinical outcomes.
title: Circulating PACAP levels are associated with increased amygdala-default mode network resting-state connectivity in posttraumatic stress disorder

finding: The C-allele of the IL6 SNP (rs1800795 G>C) was found to be associated with an increased risk of rejection for male organ donors, with a hazard ratio of 1.31. However, this increased risk was not observed in female organ donors, nor in recipients of either sex. This SNP's effects were significant among male donors, indicating a possible sex dimorphism in the association with rejection.
title: Donor genetic variants in interleukin-6 and interleukin-6 receptor associate with biopsy-proven rejection following kidney transplantation

finding: The SNP rs10227454 was noted as a genome-wide significant risk locus in the female-only analysis, located about one megabase from locus 4 associated with the gene FOXP2.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The SNP rs4727799 was a genome-wide significant association identified in the sensitivity analysis, linked to the gene FOXP2, thereby emphasizing its importance in BPD risk.
title: Genome-wide association study of borderline personality disorder identifies six loci and highlights shared risk with mental and somatic disorders

finding: The analysis of the Serpine 1 gene (rs1799768) revealed that over 50% of patients harbored at least one mutation, which included approximately 42% homozygote dominant, 39% heterozygote, and 15% homozygote recessive.
title: KASP-PCR method to screen thrombophilia genetic risk factors

finding: SNP rs6955423 within the PSPH gene at locus 7p11.2 was newly identified as being significantly associated with MacTel (P=5.9×10-09), emphasizing its role in the genetic architecture of this condition.
title: Identification of genetic factors influencing metabolic dysregulation and retinal support for MacTel, a retinal disorder

finding: The SNP rs56232506, linked to the gene TNS3, was identified as significant in a mediation analysis concerning its interaction with CMB 216, which affected responses to NADT, demonstrating its relevance to treatment efficacy.
title: AI-Powered cellular morphometric biomarkers discovered in needle biopsy of prostatic cancer predict neoadjuvant androgen deprivation therapy response and prognosis: an international multicenter retrospective study

finding: The SNP rs2385537 was found to be associated with risk for neurodevelopmental disorders, particularly CDG, through the imputed expression of the isoform ENST00000476671 of KMT2E. The association was significant, yielding an adjusted P-value of 7.63 x 10^-3. This SNP is also located within the gene body and KMT2E is known to regulate post-translational histone methylation.
title: Isoform-level transcriptome-wide association uncovers extensive novel genetic risk mechanisms for neuropsychiatric disorders in the human brain

finding: For SNP rs7803925 located near ZNF800, findings indicated a significant association with TC relative change during statin treatment, providing a beta of -0.078 (p-value = 4.09e-08). This represented a novel association found regarding total cholesterol.
title: Leveraging large-scale biobank EHRs to enhance pharmacogenetics of cardiometabolic disease medications

finding: The study reported that the rs342293 polymorphism was associated with adverse cardiac events in patients undergoing percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI), suggesting its potential role in influencing clinical outcomes for individuals with coronary artery disease. This highlights its importance in the context of predicting CAD-related risks.
title: The prognostic value of mean platelet volume in patients with coronary artery disease: a systematic review with meta-analyses

finding: The SNP rs551227135 was associated with the CFTR gene, identified as a mild pathogenic variant with a minor allele frequency of 0.9%. This variant was classified under the classical CFTR IVS8-5T variants, which are acknowledged for their role in non-classical cystic fibrosis presentation, including conditions like CABVD and recurrent pancreatitis.
title: Complete genomic profiles of 1,496 Taiwanese reveal curated medical insights

finding: The SNP rs11763147 in the VKORC1L1 gene was identified to have a pleiotropic association with CCT through CAGE eQTL data. It was associated with CCT in a combined meta-analysis of European and Asian samples (P=4.0×10^-9). This finding indicated that VKORC1L1 may play a role in influencing CCT.
title: Mendelian randomization analysis identified genes pleiotropically associated with central corneal thickness

finding: SNP rs77199928 was found to be significantly associated with cardiovascular traits in both populations (AFR p=1.9 x 10^-08), thus qualifying as a positive and original finding.
title: Multitrait Genome-Wide Analysis in the UK Biobank Reveals Novel and Distinct Variants Influencing Cardiovascular Traits in Africans and Europeans

finding: The rs2233580 variant located in the PAX4 gene (p.R200H) was found to be associated with type 2 diabetes and had a CADD score of 29.8. It was common in East Asian populations (MAF > 0.05) but nearly monozygotic in non-East Asian populations, indicating a significant role in disease susceptibility.
title: East Asian-specific and cross-ancestry genome-wide meta-analyses provide mechanistic insights into peptic ulcer disease

finding: The study linked the RARRES2 gene polymorphism rs17173608 to serum Chemerin levels, which correlated with acute myocardial infarction and its risk factors. This association was significant in a case-control study conducted in an Iranian population, highlighting the gene's potential role in cardiovascular disease mechanisms.
title: A Bibliometric Analysis of Research Hotspots and Frontiers in Diabetes and Cardiovascular Disease Comorbidity from 2005 to 2024

finding: The rs113993960 variant (c.1521_1523del, p.Phe508del) in the CFTR gene was linked to cystic fibrosis with a robust odds ratio of 14.67, indicating a strong relationship between this pathogenic variant and the disease.
title: Decoding Genetics, Ancestry, and Geospatial Context for Precision Health

finding: The SNP rs1617640 was associated with decreased risk of overall clonal haematopoiesis (CH) with an odds ratio of 0.68 (95% CI 0.50-0.93; P=0.01). It also showed similar protective associations for both DNMT3A-mutant CH (OR 0.68, 95% CI 0.48-0.96; P=0.03) and TET2-mutant CH (OR 0.48, 95% CI 0.24-0.97; P=0.04). Additionally, this variant had a significant association with increased plasma EPO protein levels, indicating its role as an instrumental variable in predicting EPO levels.
title: Genetically predicted plasma erythropoietin levels and clonal haematopoiesis risk: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The SNP rs11976235, a rare missense variant, was also linked with reduced risks of overall clonal haematopoiesis, DNMT3A-mutant CH, and TET2-mutant CH, though the associations were less significant compared to those found with rs1617640. Specifically, the associations indicated an odds ratio of 0.87 for overall CH (95% CI 0.69-1.11; P=0.26), 0.81 for DNMT3A-mutant CH (95% CI 0.62-1.06; P=0.12), and 0.79 for TET2-mutant CH (95% CI 0.46-1.36; P=0.40). Furthermore, this variant was the strongest association for plasma EPO levels in the EPO gene region as per the UK Biobank study.
title: Genetically predicted plasma erythropoietin levels and clonal haematopoiesis risk: a Mendelian randomisation study

finding: The single nucleotide variant rs11768878 was identified as being significantly associated with peak forward velocity at the aortic annulus (Ao_FVmax), with a p-value of -log10 p = 43.30. This SNV was located near the elastin gene ELN, which is related to Mendelian aortic diseases.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The variant rs34098933 showed significant correlation with forward left ventricular stroke volume, yielding a p-value of -log10 p = 8.33. It was located near the SLC12A9 gene.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: Variant rs4719607 was significantly associated with BSA-indexed aortic valve regurgitation volume, achieving a p-value of -log10 p = 7.34.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The SNV rs7782306 was among the three most significant variants for the causal model with aortic annulus area as the exposure, showing proximity to the ELN gene, which is involved in connective tissue pathways.
title: Genetic architecture of cardiac dynamic flow volumes

finding: The SNP rs79970906 was associated with brushite stone composition and was located in the coding region of the NXPH1 gene on chromosome 7. This gene codes for Neurexophilin 1, which is implicated in various biological processes, including immune responses and osteoblast activity.
title: Evaluation of genetic associations with clinical phenotypes of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs4725104 was also significantly associated with brushite stone composition in the NXPH1 gene region on chromosome 7. Similar to rs79970906, this finding linked the SNP to biological functions related to calcium handling.
title: Evaluation of genetic associations with clinical phenotypes of kidney stone disease

finding: The SNP rs42039 was associated with both BMI and stroke. In the analysis, it was excluded by the semiparametric estimator PSEE, which indicated its suspicion as an invalid instrument, contrasting with the assumption of validity used in the two-stage least squares (TSLS) method leading to different causal effect estimates.
title: Penalized Semiparametric Estimation for Causal Inference with Possibly Invalid Instruments

finding: The SNP rs4632959 was positively linked as it colocalized with cg03676485 (LFNG), a HDL-associated CpG for systolic and diastolic blood pressure at a PPFC of 0.99. This finding suggested a strong connection between DNA methylation at this site and blood pressure regulation.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: SNP rs4728142 was reported as a strong positive original finding, acting as a significant cis-mQTL variant for cg12816198 (IRF5), influencing systolic blood pressure. Its MR analysis indicated a causal role in modifying DNA methylation level that subsequently affected blood pressure.
title: Elucidating the genetic architecture of DNA methylation to identify promising molecular mechanisms of disease

finding: In the recent GWAS of RTV, rs17167210 was reported as a lead variant with a significance of p = 1.5 x 10^-9. It is located in an intron of EXOC4 and serves as an expression quantitative trait locus (eQTL) for both EXOC4 and LRGUK in brain tissue, implicating it in gene regulatory mechanisms tied to reaction time variability.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: rs11768150 was associated with rs17167210, showing impressive linkage disequilibrium (R2 = 0.88) and had a significant p-value of 1.71 x 10^-7. This variant exhibits a CADD score of 13.5 and a RegulomeDB score of 3a, indicating its likely role in gene regulation within the context of RTV.
title: Genome-wide association study in 404,302 individuals identifies 7 significant loci for reaction time variability

finding: The study confirmed that the rs4731702 variant had a maternal-specific association with gene expression of KLF14 and type 2 diabetes risk. This maternal impact was previously identified in Icelandic and American Indian populations.
title: Genome-wide survey of parent-of-origin specific associations across clinical traits derived from electronic health records

finding: The SNP rs76949143 was identified within the 7q11.21 locus and was shown to lie between the TPST1 and KCTD7 genes. It was associated with the significant methylation probe cg08118333, which demonstrated a direct linear correlation with right striatal DAT binding among 96 healthy individuals as determined in the study.
title: Epigenetic and cognitive signatures of striatal DAT binding among healthy elderly individuals

finding: The SNP rs62492368 was identified as an index variant associated with type 2 diabetes within the intron of the AOC1 gene. It was part of the colocalization analysis indicating shared genetic risk with knee osteoarthritis.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: The SNP rs7794796, associated with appendicular lean mass, was also identified as an index variant in the intron of the AOC1 gene and demonstrated opposite risk-increasing alleles compared to type 2 diabetes and knee osteoarthritis, indicating a complex interaction between these traits.
title: Insights into the comorbidity between type 2 diabetes and osteoarthritis

finding: The variant rs182113773 showed a genome-wide significant association in the cardiometabolic joint test (p=2.71×10⁻⁸) and is located within the intron of MACC1. It exhibited regulatory properties within immune cells (neutrophils, monocytes, and B cells) and may contribute to COVID-19 severity via its interaction with immune response and cardiometabolic health, as increased neutrophil counts are associated with clinical severity.
title: Gene-environment interaction analysis incorporating sex, cardiometabolic diseases, and multiple deprivation index reveals novel genetic associations with COVID-19 severity

finding: SNP rs111593852 was significantly associated with PSP with a p-value of 3.75 × 10^-7, implicating its role in transcriptional initiation through the TRIM24 gene.
title: Whole-Genome Sequencing Analysis Reveals New Susceptibility Loci and Structural Variants Associated with Progressive Supranuclear Palsy

finding: The SNP rs2944819 was found intronic to the gene CALN1, which was located within an open chromatin region (OCR) mapped in cortical ganglionic eminence neural populations (CGE-N and LGE-N). This finding indicated a potential role of rs2944819 in the development of genetic risk for schizophrenia.
title: Genetic implication of prenatal GABAergic and cholinergic neuron development in susceptibility to schizophrenia

finding: The intronic SNP rs11972718 was located within an OCR mapped exclusively in the medial ganglionic eminence neuron populations (MGE-N) within the gene NXPH1. This suggested a significant association with schizophrenia susceptibility linked to the neuronal development processes associated with this locus.
title: Genetic implication of prenatal GABAergic and cholinergic neuron development in susceptibility to schizophrenia

finding: The variant rs2280548 in the MAD1L1 gene was associated with both mLOX and mLOY, with the effect size for mLOX being lower than that for mLOY, indicating a need to consider different biological processes for these variants.
title: Population analyses of mosaic X chromosome loss identify genetic drivers and widespread signatures of cellular selection

finding: The rs36170929 SNP was associated with COVID-19 breakthrough infections (BI) at genome-wide significance, demonstrating a P-value of 4.39e-8. This SNP mapped to LOC102725191 and served as an eQTL for the VWDE gene, which is involved in inflammation and hemostasis. The finding suggested a potential link between COVID-19 and elevated levels of von Willebrand Factor (vWF), which may increase thrombosis risk in patients.
title: Genome-wide association study of COVID-19 Breakthrough Infections and genetic overlap with other diseases: A study of the UK Biobank

finding: The SNP rs308107 was associated with increases in regulatory activity in enhancer, promoter, and CTCF-Cohesin categories, particularly related to the RERE transcript levels. RERE is recognized as a syndromic autism gene, with mutations linked to autism. This relationship underscored its potential role in major depression and intelligence, indicating a connection between genetic factors and various neurological traits.
title: An unbiased de novo network analysis uncovering causal genes and the developmental intersection between autism and co-occurring traits

finding: This variant was found to be an sQTL associated with a cryptic splicing event in the SP4 gene, linked to schizophrenia (SCZ) and bipolar disorder (BIP) GWAS. The risk allele increased the inclusion of a 181 bp cryptic exon, likely introducing a frameshift and premature stop codon.
title: Cross-ancestry, cell-type-informed atlas of gene, isoform, and splicing regulation in the developing human brain

finding: The SNP rs12113350 was associated with the biology of brain metastases (BMs) as discussed in the study related to metastases from unknown primary tumors. The study indicated that this SNP might play a role in understanding the targeted agents for treating BMs, with specific attention to the characteristics and distribution of metastases from various cancer types including lung and breast cancer. The findings suggest a potential genetic implication in the observed behaviors of BMs, linking the SNP to the prognosis and clinical challenges faced by patients.
title: A Large Scale Multi-dataset Investigation of Brain Metastases Distribution Based on Primary Cancer Type

finding: SNP rs17685, an exonic variant in POR, was found to be novel in the MTAG analysis and associated with decreased risk for both OUD and AUD.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs2696880 was an intronic variant in CNOT4, identified as a novel GWS locus with no prior associations found.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: SNP rs6974377 was an intergenic variant near SP4 identified as novel for associations with smoking.
title: Multi-trait Analysis of GWAS (MTAG) of Substance Use Traits Identifies Novel Genetic Loci and Phenomic Associations

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was highlighted for its strong association with depression (P = 2.30 × 10^−16), being downstream of TMEM106B. It was identified as a functional SNP confirming the regulation of TMEM106B's expression, contributing significant insights into the genetic architecture of depression.
title: Cross-ancestry genome-wide association study and systems-level integrative analyses implicate new risk genes and therapeutic targets for depression

finding: The SNP rs78655421 was associated with cystic fibrosis carrier status within the UK Biobank cohort. This missense variant was included in auxiliary analyses to identify mitigated phenotypes associated with cystic fibrosis. The study found that carriers of cystic fibrosis variants, including those identified by this SNP, exhibited increased risk of various mitigated disease phenotypes, suggesting that even heterozygous carriers could experience notable health implications.
title: A spectrum of recessiveness among Mendelian disease variants in UK Biobank

finding: The rs77810251 variant at the PTPRZ1 locus demonstrated a positive association with HDL levels in the 'ever-smoking' exposure group, while showing no association among 'never-smoking' individuals. The interaction P value was found to be 9.5x10^-7. This variant was also an eQTL for PTPRZ1 in aorta tissue, linked to decreased gene expression, illustrating its role in the gene-lipid interaction influenced by smoking.
title: Multi-omics insights into the biological mechanisms underlying gene-by-lifestyle interactions with smoking and alcohol consumption detected by genome-wide trans-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The C1GALT1-330G/T variant (rs1008898) was part of a significant interaction found to correlate with IgAN pathogenesis, showing a statistical significance (P < 0.001).
title: Candidate genes for IgA nephropathy in pediatric patients: exome-wide association study

finding: The SNP rs10273639 was identified as a functional variant in the PRSS1 promoter, and it was found to be in linkage disequilibrium with a chronic pancreatitis-protecting variant. This finding highlighted the significance of this SNP in relation to chronic pancreatitis (CP), providing insights into genetic factors that may confer protection against the disease.
title: A proposed general variant classification framework using chronic pancreatitis as a disease model

finding: The SNP rs4721411 was identified as a lead variant at the MAD1L1 locus at 7q21.11, associated with axial motor presentation in Parkinson's disease (PD). It showed a Beta of 0.54, SE of 0.11, and a P-value of 1.6e-7, indicating a strong association relevant to PD motor severity.
title: Association of genetic variation at the GJA5/ACP6 locus with motor progression in Parkinson’s

finding: The SNP rs776746, corresponding to CYP3A5*3, was identified as contributing to genetic variation in tacrolimus dose response. It was noted that this variant was part of the larger model assessing the metabolic pathways influencing tacrolimus pharmacokinetics in lung transplant patients.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs10264272, linked to CYP3A5*6, was examined for its role in influencing tacrolimus metabolism. This variant, similar to rs776746, was crucial to the classification of patients' metabolism groups, affecting dosage requirements post-transplant.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs35599367, indicative of CYP3A4*22, was also analyzed as it was previously shown to influence tacrolimus dose response. The study recognized its role alongside CYP3A5 variants in determining individual dosing strategies.
title: Development and validation of a population pharmacokinetic model to guide perioperative tacrolimus dosing after lung transplantation

finding: The SNP rs3110823 in the STMP1 gene was reported significant at the replication threshold in the EUR cohort, with a positive effect size (βA allele = 0.056, p = 2.24 × 10^-6), indicating an association with mitochondrial DNA copy number.
title: The genetic and phenotypic correlates of mtDNA copy number in a multi-ancestry cohort

finding: The SNP rs4726467 located within the TBXAS1 gene was significantly associated with mortality in PD (HR = 2.04, 95% CI 1.63 to 2.56; p = 7.71 x 10^-10). This suggested an important role for thromboxane A synthase in the context of PD mortality.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs145274312, which is near the ASNS gene, showed significant association with motor progression (p < 5 x 10^-8), although the specific details of its impact were not elaborated.
title: Genome-wide determinants of mortality and motor progression in Parkinson’s disease

finding: The SNP rs150022429 was also linked to stroke of any mechanism in the TOPMed analysis, highlighting its potential role among rare genetic variants associated with stroke susceptibility.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: The SNP rs141857337 was found to be associated with hemorrhagic stroke in the context of the TOPMed program study which aimed at finding susceptibility loci driven by rare variants.
title: Whole Exome Sequencing Analyses Support a Role of Vitamin D Metabolism in Ischemic Stroke

finding: This SNP was identified as the lead PRSS2-eQTL variant with a significant effect size linked to pancreatic expression, having complete linkage with the haplotype structure. It showed a strong association with alcoholic chronic pancreatitis in a previous large-scale study, indicating its critical role in pancreatitis risk.
title: Structural evolution of trypsinogen gene redundancy confers risk for pancreas diseases

finding: The SNP rs12705966 was associated with SGIT and was previously recognized in the literature as a significant genetic marker relevant to chronic pain conditions.
title: Decomposing the genetic background of chronic back pain

finding: The alternate allele at rs10950456 in MAD1L1 showed a protective effect against mCA and was associated with reduced cancer risk, aligning with the antagonistic pleiotropy observed in SPDL1 and MAD1L1.
title: Genetic variant in SPDL1 reveals novel mechanism linking pulmonary fibrosis risk and cancer protection

finding: The rs2049603 variant was significantly associated with osteoarthritis (OA) in a multi-ancestry meta-analysis involving Veterans in the Million Veteran Program (MVP). It replicated in the UK Biobank (UKB) European ancestry group but not in African, Asian, or Hispanic ancestry groups, suggesting a strong association primarily within the European population.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: Similar to rs2049603, the rs1916980 variant also showed significant association with OA in the MVP and replicated in the UKB European ancestry group. This variant was identified as a causal SNP in the FOXP2 gene region linked to OA.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: The rs2396724 variant was significantly associated with OA in the MVP multi-ancestry analysis as well as in MVP-European participants, though it was only nominally significant in UKB-European. There was evidence of heterogeneity of effects suggesting varied impacts across different populations.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: rs11764536 within the HDAC9 gene showed association with OA in the Hispanic Veterans sample, replicating also in the combined MVP and UKB analyses, indicating potential association across multiple studies.
title: Novel Genetic Loci Associated with Osteoarthritis in Multi-Ancestry Analyses in 484,374 Participants from MVP and the UK Biobank

finding: High-risk infants were reported to have a significantly higher frequency of homozygosity for ABCB1 variant rs1045642 (43.6% vs. 18.7%, p<0.001) compared to the Ensembl database. This variant was noted to influence the pharmacokinetics of opioids by affecting drug transport across the blood-brain barrier.
title: Identifying Opioid-Related Pharmacogenomic Variants in High-Risk Hospitalized Infants: A Pilot Study

finding: There was a significantly higher frequency of homozygosity for ABCB1 variant rs2032582 in high-risk infants (42.7% vs. 15.9%, p<0.001) when compared to the broader genetic cohorts found in Ensembl. This variant contributes to opioid pharmacokinetics.
title: Identifying Opioid-Related Pharmacogenomic Variants in High-Risk Hospitalized Infants: A Pilot Study

finding: The SNP rs10279675, near ORC5, was also shown to interact with prenatal stress affecting DNAm at cg06592260 in EPPK1. The association was significant (B=-0.012, SE=0.002, p=2.76×10^-13), adding to the evidence of how genetic variants in conjunction with maternal stress could influence epigenetic mechanisms.
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: The SNP rs2188287, located near ORC5, interacted with cumulative prenatal stress to show a significant association with DNAm at cg06592260 in EPPK1 (B=-0.013, SE=0.002, p=1.85×10^-13). This result highlighted the importance of SNP interactions with prenatal environmental factors on epigenetic outcomes.
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: The SNP rs10251976, also near ORC5, was identified to have a significant interaction with cumulative prenatal stress, affecting DNAm at cg06592260 in EPPK1 (B=-0.012, SE=0.002, p=7.32×10^-13). This finding supported the notion that genetic variants can modulate how prenatal stress impacts epigenetic changes related to offspring health.
title: Interactive effects of genotype with prenatal stress on DNA methylation at birth

finding: This intronic SNP was located in the MAD1L1 gene on chromosome 7 and was associated with conversion from active surveillance to active treatment in men with low-risk prostate cancer, indicated by a hazard ratio (HR) of 5.65 and a p-value of 7 x 10^-10.
title: Genetic Factors Associated with Prostate Cancer Conversion from Active Surveillance to Treatment

finding: The variant rs776746 in CYP3A5 exhibited the largest average difference in allele frequency between European and Asian populations (0.331) suggesting substantial genetic heterogeneity affecting pharmacogenomic applicability.
title: Diversity and level of evidence evaluation of commercial pharmacogenomic testing for mental health

finding: The SNP rs12705715 was deemed nominally significant in the replication analysis at p<0.05, contributing to the findings related to TBI and was classified within the results of the EA cohort.
title: Genome-wide Association Study of Traumatic Brain Injury in U.S. Military Veterans Enrolled in the VA Million Veteran Program

finding: The study found a novel signal at rs190894416 located at 7p14.2 associated with dysentery, showing an OR of 16 and a p-value of 6.9 x 10^-9, indicating a strong genetic link to the disease.
title: A global atlas of genetic associations of 220 deep phenotypes

finding: Unique to the analysis of individuals of European ancestry, this SNP was close to FLNC and had previous associations with various cardiomyopathies, indicating its relevance to cardiac structural genetics.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: This SNP was closely related to TTN and represented the strongest association with LVMI in the study, further validating previous reports linking it to cardiomyopathy.
title: Clinical and Genetic Associations of Deep Learning-Derived Cardiac Magnetic Resonance-Based Left Ventricular Mass

finding: Associated with the TNRC18 gene, SNP rs748670681 showed robust association with anterior uveitis (p = 2.0 × 10−132) and was also linked to inflammatory bowel disease. The TNRC18 gene's role in modulating immune response further reinforces the SNP's significance.
title: Genome-wide association study of anterior uveitis

finding: Similar to rs3103257, rs6961970 was identified as a lead SNP in one of the novel anxiety loci and was located intronically in the FOXP2 gene, also showing potential functional significance indicated by a high CADD score.
title: Identification of Novel Genomic Loci for Anxiety and Extensive Genetic Overlap with Psychiatric Disorders

finding: The SNP rs1800796 was associated with ischemic stroke (IS) risk in previous research, specifically showing a connection to interleukin-6 levels, which could influence inflammatory processes related to stroke.
title: Integrative genetic analysis reveals new relationships between intraocular pressure, glaucoma and ischemic stroke risk: A study based on combined SNP-to-gene, mendelian randomization and pathway investigations

finding: The non-synonymous variant rs34372369 in the gene EPHA1 was associated with LDL-C, nonHDL-C, and TC levels exclusively in females. This finding highlighted the potential influence of sex hormone binding globulin gene expression, especially since the variant's link was stronger in males regarding SHBG.
title: Implicating genes, pleiotropy and sexual dimorphism at blood lipid loci through multi-ancestry meta-analysis

finding: The G allele at rs113525298 was associated with increased first-out-of-bed minutes and decreased vigorously active minutes. This SNP lies near ELFN1, a gene involved in interneuron recruitment. The G allele was found at a lower frequency in the ADHD cohort compared to healthy individuals, suggesting a potential protective role against hyperactivity disorders.
title: Digital phenotyping from wearables using AI characterizes psychiatric disorders and identifies genetic associations

finding: Associated with testosterone levels in women, this SNP demonstrated a beta of -0.131 and an exceptional p-value (P=4.02E-86), indicating a significant connection to hormonal disruptions.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This SNP linked to testosterone levels in women showed a beta of -0.116 (P=2.03E-08), suggesting its role in fertility-related hormonal profiles.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: This variant was categorized as a female testosterone-lowering missense variant associated with primary ovarian insufficiency, although it did not show significant association with female infertility in the UK Biobank (P>0.05).
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The rs100171569 variant was linked to idiopathic infertility in women, with an odds ratio of 2.63 (P=1.25E-03), marking it as a notable risk factor for infertility.
title: Genome-wide analyses identify 21 infertility loci and over 400 reproductive hormone loci across the allele frequency spectrum

finding: The intronic variant rs1563408 in the FOXP2 gene was significantly associated with neurodevelopmental and externalizing conditions, having a P value of 2.44e-8, although it was not linked directly to individual differences in impulsivity.
title: The pleiotropic architecture of human impulsivity across biological scales

finding: Functionally characterized in the DDC gene, this SNP's association with hypertension was confirmed in the IBI approach, illustrating its relevance.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: This SNP was shown to have associations with hypertension and was included in the IBI analysis, reinforcing its relevance in hypertension studies.
title: An individualized Bayesian method for estimating genomic variants of hypertension

finding: The SNP rs11767557 was identified as a variant that regulates the expression of the EPHA1 gene specifically in human whole blood. This finding was considered significant within the context of Alzheimer's Disease (AD) research, where variations in gene expression have implications for understanding the biological mechanisms associated with the disease.
title: Analysis of Blood Gene Expression Data Toward Early Detection of Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: An association between rs186721582 and antibodies against Epstein-Barr virus was replicated in UK Biobank (P = 7.3×10^-10, β = -0.09), although the effect size was in the opposite direction.
title: Genetic analyses of common infections in the Avon Longitudinal Study of Parents and Children cohort

finding: At the ZCPW1 locus, rs6979218 was identified as an MPRA-allelic variant showing significant activity only in proinflammatory macrophages, thus highlighting its context-specific regulatory role.
title: Deciphering the functional impact of Alzheimer’s Disease-associated variants in resting and proinflammatory immune cells

finding: The SNP rs1805123, which corresponds to the KCNH2 gene, was identified as a common mutation in a patient cohort diagnosed with macrodactyly. This mutation led to a nonsynonymous substitution of threonine for lysine at position 897 of the potassium channel. The study reported that 36% of the patients were carriers of this mutation, with 2 patients being homozygous. The prevalence of the K897T variant observed aligns with existing minor allele frequency estimates in primarily European ancestry populations, reported to be around 23-25%. Additionally, it was noted that one Hispanic patient carried this variant, which had a relatively high frequency (17%) in that background.
title: Characterization of coordinated growth in macrodactyly caused by somatic mosaic activating mutations in PIK3CA

finding: The SNP rs1476679 was identified as the discovery lead SNP in the ZCWPW1 locus, which is significant for Alzheimer's disease (AD). It demonstrated strong regulatory potential and was shown to be an eQTL for both PILRB and ZCWPW1, suggesting its role in modulating the expression of these genes in relation to AD risk.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs1859788, an exonic common variant in PILRA, was reported in multiple GWAS studies as a lead variant with a potential protective effect in AD, possibly reducing inhibitory signaling in microglia.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs12539172, located in the 3' UTR of NYAP1, was one of four lead variants highlighted for its role in AD, although the exact mechanism was less clear compared to other variants in the locus.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The intronic variant rs7384878 in PMS2P1 was also identified as a lead variant in the ZCWPW1 risk locus for AD, contributing to the understanding of the genetic architecture of the disease.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: The SNP rs531189257, an intronic variation in PILRA, was exclusively found in 10 AD patients, indicating it could be associated with AD risk through potential regulatory effects pertaining to PILRA.
title: ZCWPW1 loss-of-function variants in Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: SNP rs10499948 was associated with genes CYP3A4 and CYP3A5, with a P-meta value of 5.91 x 10^-5. This finding indicates a role for these genes in lipid metabolism and potentially in the mechanisms underlying lipoedema.
title: Investigation of clinical characteristics and genome associations in the ‘UK Lipoedema’ cohort

finding: The novel SNP rs138433183 was identified at an intronic region of the ESYT2 gene, tagged as a rare variant associated with residual age-at-onset in Huntington disease. It achieved genome-wide significance due to enhanced statistical power using relative residual age-at-onset.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs545857783 was mentioned alongside rs138433183 and was linked to the ESYT2 gene, where both SNPs were associated with residual age-at-onset in Huntington disease patients.
title: Clinical and genetic association studies reveal within-individual variability as an integral part of Huntington disease

finding: The SNP rs11771145 was cited as having the strongest association with Alzheimer's disease at the EPHA1-AS1 locus. Although it fell outside the 95% confidence intervals in the AD GWAS used for colocalization analysis, strong correlations were observed between its location 130bp from an OCR peak and the expression of EPHA1-AS1, highlighting its genetic regulatory role in Alzheimer's disease etiology.
title: Genetics of the human microglia regulome refines Alzheimer’s disease risk loci

finding: The SNP rs80227144, located near the semaphorin gene cluster, was discovered to be associated with an increased risk of Hirschsprung disease (HSCR), contributing to the understanding of genetic risk factors linked to this condition.
title: Size matters: large copy number losses reveal novel Hirschsprung disease genes

finding: rs4410790 was located upstream of the AHR gene, which regulates CYP1A1 and CYP1A2 and is activated by compounds in coffee. It was previously linked with caffeine intake from tea and various traits including caffeine metabolism, bitter beverage intake, and urine biomarkers. This SNP was also replicated from earlier studies.
title: Genome-Wide Association Studies of Coffee Intake in UK/US Participants of European Ancestry Uncover Gene-Cohort Influences

finding: This intronic noncoding RNA variant was associated with blood pressure and connected to JAZF1, which is also known for its diabetes association.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS for venous thromboembolism identifies novel loci followed by experimental validation in zebrafish

finding: The SNP rs17773014 demonstrated a borderline significant association for cytogenetically normal AML, exhibiting an OR of 1.26 and a P-value of 4.09 × 10^-7, mapping close to the AKR1B1 gene on 7q33.
title: Genome-wide association study identifies susceptibility loci for acute myeloid leukemia

finding: The SNP chr7:100494172:T:C associated with the NYAP1 gene was noted as a damaging missense variant that completely co-segregated with common variants in the EFIGA families, suggesting its possible influence on Alzheimer's disease risk.
title: Identification of Rare Damaging Missense and Loss of Function Variants in GWAS Loci Using Genome Sequencing Data from Two Cohorts of Familial Late-Onset Alzheimer’s Disease

finding: There was significant evidence for rs75639044 near COG5, which showed a major impact on sleep duration by decreasing gene expression in the spinal cord and exhibited associations with sleep traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: The rs1978085 SNP had significant associations with frequent napping and was linked in high LD with rs75639044 in COG5, indicating its relevance to sleep-related traits.
title: Multi-ancestry genome-wide analysis identifies common genetic variants for self-reported sleep duration and shared genetic effects

finding: This SNP was linked to age-related macular degeneration, with an identified allelic effect impacting expression and disrupting a miRNA binding site.
title: Genome-wide functional screen of 3’UTR variants uncovers causal variants for human disease and evolution

finding: The rs36036340 SNP was associated with nuclei granularity, as suggested by the metric Nuclei_Granularity_9_AGP. This variant lies within the PRKAR1B gene, which has been linked to neurodevelopmental disorders and tumorigenesis, indicating that rs36036340 may affect cellular morphology related to Golgi apparatus dynamics and cellular proliferation due to its involvement in the PI3K/AKT/mTOR signaling pathway. The effect size was 0.38 with a p-value of 6×10^-10.
title: High-dimensional phenotyping to define the genetic basis of cellular morphology

finding: The SNP rs1859788 was identified as a missense variant (p.Arg78Gly) in the paired immunoglobin-like type 2 receptor alpha (PILRa), which has protective associations with Alzheimer's disease. Contextually, this SNP is located in a gene largely expressed in myeloid cells and implicated in immune responses, particularly in cell movement towards infection sites. Additionally, the study proposed a link between this SNP, chromogranin expression, TNF-α levels, and insulin regulation, suggesting that it plays a role in relevant metabolic and immune pathways.
title: Pangenome reconstruction in rats enhances genotype-phenotype mapping and novel variant discovery

finding: The SNP rs606231231 was associated with polydactyly and was found to lie in the well-known ZRS enhancer that controls the expression of the SHH gene at a long range of 1 Mb. This variant was experimentally verified to alter gene expression in mouse limb.
title: GPN-MSA: an alignment-based DNA language model for genome-wide variant effect prediction
