finding: As with the others, this SNP displayed significant frequency differences and belonged to the same group of adaptive SNVs linked to a deletion, highlighting its adaptive significance in the context of HAA.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: This SNP also exhibited significantly different frequencies between the populations and was strongly linked with the deletion, contributing to our understanding of HAA.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: Like the other five SNPs, this SNP was part of the adaptive SNVs identified, confirming its potential influence on gene expression related to adaptability to high-altitude environments.
title: Characterization of Structural Variation in Tibetans Reveals New Evidence of High-altitude Adaptation and Introgression

finding: The SNP rs4487645 was identified as a causal SNP associated with myeloma using nucleotide-level models, which successfully differentiated it from other SNPs.
title: Cross-species prediction of transcription factor binding by adversarial training of a novel nucleotide-level deep neural network

finding: The lead SNP rs2944833, located on chromosome 7, was identified in a CC-GWAS-specific locus comparing SCZ to MDD. It produced a significant SMR colocalization result for the CALN1 gene, which is involved in neuronal function and related to memory and learning. This locus had previously shown associations with educational attainment, intelligence, cognitive function, and schizophrenia in meta-analyses, demonstrating its relevance in psychiatric traits.
title: Identifying loci with different allele frequencies among cases of eight psychiatric disorders using CC-GWAS

finding: The variant rs139141690 impacted <italic>CUX1</italic> expression, demonstrating its regulatory role in megakaryopoiesis and was linked to phenotypes such as mean platelet volume (MPV).
title: Variant-to-function dissection of rare non-coding GWAS loci with high impact on blood traits

finding: The missense coding variant rs2107732 in the CCM2 gene was found to be associated with a decreased risk of coronary artery disease (CAD) in multiple genome-wide association studies (GWAS), with an odds ratio of 0.92 and a significance level of P = 1.53 × 10^-8. This variant caused a valine-to-isoleucine substitution at amino acid 74 in the PTB domain of CCM2, which is crucial for its interactions with KRIT1.
title: Mapping the convergence of genes for coronary artery disease onto endothelial cell programs

finding: SNP rs39451 was significant and considered likely to be involved in the regulation of KCS4. It co-localized with other SNPs in the promoter region, suggesting a combined regulatory effect that is crucial for the expression of KCS4 and the subsequent TAG biosynthesis.
title: Hello darkness, my old friend: 3-Ketoacyl-Coenzyme A Synthase4 is a branch point in the regulation of triacylglycerol synthesis in Arabidopsis by re-channeling fatty acids under carbon starvation

finding: The SNP rs12666347 was found to be associated with significantly elevated serum levels of epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR) in the MESA and Framingham cohorts. Individuals with this SNP exhibited elevated coronary artery calcium (CAC), indicating its potential role in vascular calcification, particularly in the context of chronic kidney disease (CKD).
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: The SNP rs7806938 was identified as having a significant association with serum EGFR levels. This SNP was also correlated with increased coronary artery calcium in the MESA and Framingham cohorts, supporting its role in the mechanisms of vascular calcification seen in CKD.
title: Epidermal Growth Factor Receptor Inhibition Prevents Caveolin-1-dependent Calcifying Extracellular Vesicle Biogenesis

finding: This SNP scored higher than other variants in its locus including GWAS SNP rs3735025, indicating a key finding related to schizophrenia.
title: WEVar: a novel statistical learning framework for predicting noncoding regulatory variants

finding: This variant, identified as causal for cystic fibrosis, was included in a model query involving a typical symptom of the disease. The model was engaged in a natural language conversation to assess potential disease-causing variants, highlighting the relevance of rs75527207 in the context of cystic fibrosis.
title: Boosting GPT Models for Genomics Analysis: Generating Trusted Genetic Variant Annotations and Interpretations through RAG and fine-tuning

finding: The study found an association of the C allele of rs1800795, located at the IL6 gene, with COVID-19 severity. It noted that IL-6 plasmatic levels were higher among IL6 CC genotype carriers. Furthermore, previous meta-analysis by the same group supported this finding by correlating the frequency of the C allele with COVID-19 mortality rates worldwide.
title: Association of polymorphisms of IL-6 pathway genes (IL6, IL6R and IL6ST) with COVID-19 severity in an Amazonian population

finding: The SNP rs7789995 was located in the 5' flanking region of the STR D7S820 and contributed to the formation of the highest number of alleles (11 alleles) in that STR. This finding was significant as it highlighted the impact of variations in the flanking regions on increasing genetic diversity.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: The SNP rs16887642, situated in the 3' flanking region of D7S820, also contributed to the increased allelic variation observed in that STR, reinforcing the importance of both 5' and 3' flanking variations in generating genetic diversity.
title: The concordance of length- and sequence-based STRs used in forensic markers with guidance for practice

finding: The SNP rs118137629 was linked to the ELFNI gene, known for its association with mathematical ability and educational attainment. Its relevance was highlighted by finding significant p-values (0.004 and 0.01) for other SNPs in the same gene.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The SNP rs4720942 mapped to the ELFNI gene and had a p-value of 0.004, indicating its association with cognitive traits as identified in GWAS.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The SNP rs10950352 also mapped to the ELFNI gene, presenting a p-value of 0.01. This suggests its importance in relation to cognitive abilities measured in the analysis.
title: Comparing the XGBoost machine learning algorithm to polygenic scoring for the prediction of intelligence based on genotype data

finding: The rs9690350 polymorphism in the PDGFA gene was identified as increasing the risk of biliary atresia in Chinese children, highlighting its significant association with this particular fibro-inflammatory disease.
title: Efemp1 modulates elastic fiber formation and mechanics of the extrahepatic bile duct

finding: The SNP rs4726571 was significantly associated with TRBV28, showing a beta of -0.957 and a p-value of 2.12 x 10^-40. This association replicated at the single-cell level across all CD8+ cells, indicating a pan T cell mechanism.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs361489 was associated with TRBV4-3, showing a beta of 0.571 and a p-value of 9.83 x 10^-12, indicating its role as a secondary signal that influences the usage of this V-gene.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: rs17249 showed a peak secondary signal with TRBV4-3, having a beta of -0.460 and a p-value of 2.66 x 10^-11, suggesting the involvement of multiple germline variants in determining the usage of this V-gene.
title: Defining the genetic determinants of CD8+ T cell receptor repertoire in the context of immune checkpoint blockade

finding: The SNP rs12704907 was associated with the phenotype 'Cause of death: other specified respiratory disorders'. This association showed a significant positive correlation with the C-allele variant, highlighted by a p-value of 2*10^-5.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: Similar to rs12704907, the C-allele of rs4729325 was significantly associated with the phenotype 'Cause of death: other specified respiratory disorders' with a corresponding p-value of 2*10^-5.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: The SNP rs3211938 was identified as a coding SNP that results in CD36 protein deficiency when homozygous for the G allele (G/G), which is associated with increased incidence of endothelial dysfunction, vascular stiffening, stroke, and cardiovascular diseases. Its role in neutrophil activation was highlighted, indicating that individuals carrying this SNP had higher levels of CD62L shedding, suggesting ongoing neutrophil activation that might contribute to inflammation and underlying vascular issues.
title: Insulin regulates lymphatic endothelial function via palmitoylation

finding: The rs6850 SNP was found to be associated with elevated plasma levels of cyclophilin A in patients with coronary artery disease, suggesting its involvement in cardiovascular pathology.
title: Identification of biomarkers, pathways and potential therapeutic targets for heart failure using bioinformatics analysis

finding: The SNP rs2522833, associated with the gene Pclo, was identified as less common in patients with major depressive disorder (MDD) who had a family history of the condition. This finding indicated a potential genetic link between Pclo and emotional processing related to MDD, suggesting that the C allele of this SNP may influence susceptibility to MDD, particularly in individuals with a familial predisposition.
title: Mutant screen reveals depression-associated Piccolo’s control over brain-gonad cross talk and reproductive behavior

finding: The SNP rs13246388 was associated with RKIP's role in cancer cell plasticity, specifically indicating that low RKIP levels and concomitant upregulated BACH1 levels correlated with worse clinical outcomes in various cancer types, thus highlighting its significance in mediating epithelial-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and therapy resistance.
title: A systems-level analysis of the mutually antagonistic roles of RKIP and BACH1 in dynamics of cancer cell plasticity

finding: Association of rs2405442 in PILRA was consistent with increased protective effects and showed potential for reduced risk of developing Alzheimer's disease.
title: Exome-wide age-of-onset analysis reveals exonic variants in ERN1, TACR3 and SPPL2C associated with Alzheimer’s disease

finding: The rs1990622 SNP was identified as the lead GWAS SNP for frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD-TDP) and was associated with predicted neuron proportions.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The rs10950398 SNP was linked to KCNA5, showing an association with variants affecting neuron excitability.
title: Brain expression quantitative trait locus and network analysis reveals downstream effects and putative drivers for brain-related diseases

finding: The SNP rs2299148, connected with SA3, was also implicated in academic attainment and cognitive ability, marking it as relevant in understanding genetic contributions to these phenotypes.
title: Genomic Structural Equation Modeling Reveals Latent Phenotypes in the Human Cortex with Distinct Genetic Architecture

finding: The locus represented by SNP rs534114641 at 17q21.31 displayed significant associations with neurodegenerative diseases, particularly Alzheimer's, as well as a broad connection to various traits like major depressive disorder.
title: The Genetic Heterogeneity of Multimodal Human Brain Age

finding: The SNP rs13246163 was linked to a synergistic effect with cisplatin treatment, specifically in the context of basal-like pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma cells. This finding highlighted the therapeutic potential of HSP90 inhibition in enhancing the efficacy of conventional chemotherapeutic agents.
title: HSP90 buffers deleterious genetic variations in BRCA1

finding: The SNP rs7805747 in PRKAG2 was reported as being significantly associated with both chronic kidney disease (CKD) and serum creatinine levels, linking it to increased risk in T1DM patients with ESKD.
title: Assessment of differentially methylated loci in individuals with end-stage kidney disease attributed to diabetic kidney disease

finding: The SNP rs16875285 was associated with circRNA isoform-specific expression. Specifically, the C allele of rs16875285 was found to correlate with lower expression of one circRNA isoform derived from GARS-DT while simultaneously being associated with higher expression of another circRNA isoform arising from the same long non-coding RNA.
title: Genetic Regulation of Circular RNA Expression in Human Aortic Smooth Muscle Cells and Vascular Traits

finding: The rs6092 SNP in the SERPINE1 gene was positively correlated with T2DM risk, implicating its role in the regulation of fibrinolysis and inflammation processes.
title: Bioinformatics analysis of potential key genes and mechanisms in type 2 diabetes mellitus

finding: The SNP rs1799884 was found to lie within a NEUROG3-binding site at the promoter region of the gene GCK, which is critical for insulin secretion. This suggests that NEUROG3 might directly regulate this gene, impacting glucose metabolism and potentially influencing susceptibility to type 2 diabetes.
title: Extensive NEUROG3 occupancy in the human pancreatic endocrine gene regulatory network

finding: The RedPenMC carrier exhibited the A/G genotype for rs1990622, known to affect <italic>GRN</italic> levels and age of onset in <italic>GRN</italic> mediated FTD. The presence of the G protective allele in RedPenMC indicated a possible modifier effect that may contribute to resilience against developing FTD symptoms.
title: Single-cell multimodal omics and directly reprogrammed neurons to probe reduced penetrance in Frontotemporal Dementia

finding: The eQTL variant rs11763367 for the gene WBSCR27 displayed significant GxC interactions characterized by the influence of specific cellular respiration context. This finding stressed the importance of cellular metabolic states in regulatory genetic effects.
title: CellRegMap: A statistical framework for mapping context-specific regulatory variants using scRNA-seq

finding: The SCIN intronic SNP (rs116580059) was associated with increased APOE_TX levels. It correlated negatively with Thal phase, illuminating its potential role in AD pathology. A trend was noted for lower Braak stage associations.
title: Genome-wide association study of brain biochemical phenotypes reveals distinct genetic architecture of Alzheimer’s Disease related proteins

finding: The SNP rs12113379 was identified as being associated with key biological pathways significant for tumor progression and immunomodulation. Specifically, this SNP was linked to osteopontin, a protein that plays a crucial role in cellular processes such as proliferation and inflammatory responses, which may have implications for corneal keratocyte differentiation and the pathogenesis of corneal fibrosis.
title: Investigating transcriptional differences in mechanotransductive and ECM related genes in cultured primary corneal keratocytes, fibroblasts and myofibroblasts

finding: SNP rs2107595, located in a non-coding region near HDAC9, was analyzed in edited iPSC lines and shown to exhibit allele loss. qgPCR analysis indicated that out of the clones analyzed, 5 out of 13 showed hemizygosity, which reflects the occurrences of deleterious on-target events after CRISPR editing. This SNP was recognized in GWAS studies related to stroke and coronary artery disease.
title: Detection of deleterious on-target effects after HDR-mediated CRISPR editing

finding: The frontotemporal dementia variant rs3173615 in TMEM106B was examined, showing its association with neurodegenerative diseases and providing context to the genetic profiling of iPSC lines.
title: A reference induced pluripotent stem cell line for large-scale collaborative studies

finding: The SNP rs2718058 was associated with preventative effects against Alzheimer's disease, reducing brain neurodegeneration, brain atrophy, and brain hypometabolism. This finding highlighted the role of the NME8 gene, which encodes a protein involved in ciliary dynamics.
title: Williams syndrome and autism: dissimilar socio-cognitive profiles with similar patterns of abnormal gene expression in the blood

finding: The SNP rs12155159 was associated with less cognitive decline in Alzheimer's disease, specifically linked to improved performance on the delayed word recall test. This also indicated a significant relationship with the NME8 gene, which is involved in cognitive processes related to neurodegeneration.
title: Williams syndrome and autism: dissimilar socio-cognitive profiles with similar patterns of abnormal gene expression in the blood

finding: Similar to rs182677317, the variant rs369849556 was also noted with conflicting interpretations regarding its pathogenicity for ciliary dyskinesia. The high allele frequency in the NyuWa resource indicated that this variant might not be as harmful as once believed, encouraging further research into its effects.
title: NyuWa Genome Resource: Deep Whole Genome Sequencing Based Chinese Population Variation Profile and Reference Panel

finding: The SNP rs12113431 was associated with the expression of CPT1A, which was significantly downregulated in colorectal cancer (CRC). The analysis suggested that this downregulation was linked to a decrease in radiosensitivity and an increase in radioresistance in CRC, influencing the cellular response to reactive oxygen species (ROS) and the DNA damage response. The functional studies implied that variants affecting the CPT1A expression could serve as potential biomarkers for radiosensitivity in CRC.
title: CPT1A Mediates Radiation Sensitivity in Colorectal Cancer

finding: The rs1858830 C variant in the promoter region of the MET gene was associated with autistic disorder, indicating its potential influence on disrupted language functioning that relates to the cognitive functions of the brain, particularly within the sentence processing network.
title: Gene Expression Correlates of the Cortical Network Underlying Sentence Processing

finding: The SNP rs13246301 correlated with the promotion of a tumor-supportive environment in CLL, particularly through the action of IL-9.
title: Leukemic cell-secreted interleukin-9 suppresses cytotoxic T cell-mediated killing in chronic lymphocytic leukemia

finding: The SNP rs4731702 was associated with type-2 diabetes and cholesterol levels upstream of the maternally expressed transcription factor KLF14. It exhibited maternally-restricted cis-regulatory associations with KLF14 expression in adipose tissue, indicating that KLF14 could be an adipose master transcriptional regulator, thereby influencing adiposity phenotypes.
title: Epistatic Networks Associated with Parent-of-Origin Effects on Metabolic Traits

finding: The SNP rs972283, also located upstream of KLF14, showed similar associations linked to type-2 diabetes and cholesterol levels. Its presence reinforced the idea that KLF14 regulates biallelic adipose genes, contributing to variation in expression and adiposity phenotypes.
title: Epistatic Networks Associated with Parent-of-Origin Effects on Metabolic Traits

finding: rs11771145 was linked to a functional gene in the 2013 GWAS which included 74,046 individuals of European ancestry. This finding contributed to the identification of risk loci for Alzheimer's disease (AD).
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: This SNP was part of the 2013 GWAS study that linked it to AD through genetic association studies with a significant participant size.
title: Multi-Modal Data Analysis for Alzheimer’s Disease Diagnosis: An Ensemble Model Using Imagery and Genetic Features

finding: The SNP rs10254116, located within the -707BMPER enhancer associated with craniosynostosis (CS), directed enhancer activity specifically in cranial cartilage during development. This enhancer's activity suggests a role in modulating BMP signaling relevant to CS risk.
title: Identification of conserved skeletal enhancers associated with craniosynostosis risk genes

finding: The SNP rs17168486 was associated with T2D, showing that its T allele increased DGKB expression in human islets. It was positioned approximately 45 kb upstream of the DGKB promoter and resolved multiple interaction peaks implicating its regulatory role.
title: Inferring causal genes at type 2 diabetes GWAS loci through chromosome interactions in islet cells

finding: The SNP rs12113219 was found to be associated with the reovirus, specifically regarding the function of the sigma NS RNA-binding protein. This protein was shown to be integral for the formation of intracellular compartments necessary for viral genome replication and capsid assembly. The original finding related to this SNP revealed its significance in the mechanistic understanding of the protein's oligomeric states, which are crucial for RNA chaperone activity and effective replication of the viral genome.
title: Structure of Orthoreovirus RNA Chaperone σNS, a Component of Viral Replication Factories

finding: In the IAV experiment, the reQTL rs3807865 for TMEM106B showed perturbation-specific colocalization with depression, underscoring its disease relevance.
title: Modeling heterogeneity in single-cell perturbation states enhances detection of response eQTLs

finding: The rs67070387 polymorphism within the SRRM3 intron 1 was strongly associated with increased fasting glucose (FG) levels and had a highly significant p-value, indicating its relevance in glycemic traits. Further analysis suggested that this variant was linked to higher SRRM3 expression and greater microexon inclusion.
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The SNP rs6959887 was identified as the lead variant associated with the birth weight GWAS locus on chromosome 7. This finding linked the SNP to decreased accessibility of a regulatory element and decreased expression of genes including TBX20, a transcription factor crucial for cardiac development, implicating a potential mechanism for birth weight and an increased risk of congenital heart defects.
title: Multi-omic QTL mapping in early developmental tissues reveals phenotypic and temporal complexity of regulatory variants underlying GWAS loci

finding: The low-frequency T2D-associated variant rs78840640 at the IGF2BP3 locus had significant allelic effects on beta cell chromatin. It exhibited a high causal probability for T2D and was supported by fine-mapping data, indicating a likely role in disease risk.
title: Single cell chromatin accessibility reveals pancreatic islet cell type- and state-specific regulatory programs of diabetes risk

finding: This nonsense variant in CD36 was associated with ALP levels, indicating its role in cholesterol metabolism and the potential for specific associations with malaria resistance traits.
title: Analyses of Biomarker Traits in Diverse UK Biobank Participants Identify Associations Missed by European-centric Analysis Strategies

finding: The lead SNP rs12536335 was identified in a genome-wide association study (GWAS) as significantly associated with broad antisocial behavior (ASB) at a P-value of 6.32 x 10^-10. It was located in an intronic region upstream of the transcriptional start sites for the FOXP2 gene, implicating it in the genetic underpinnings of ASB.
title: Uncovering the Genetic Architecture of Broad Antisocial Behavior through a Genome-Wide Association Study Meta-analysis

finding: Osuna-Gómez et al. (2021) linked the SNP rs13246167 to the effector mechanisms of CD8+ HLA-DR+ T cells in breast cancer patients responding to neoadjuvant chemotherapy, indicating its relevance in therapeutic efficacy.
title: Enhancing HLA-DR in Cytotoxic T Lymphocytes is crucial for the development of efficient adoptive T cell Therapies for Breast Cancer

finding: The study identified a novel SNP in bonobo FOXP2 located 75bp to the right of human rs6980093. This was the first report of genetic variation at this locus in bonobos, and though variation was observed, no social behavior differences were found based on the FOXP2 genotypes.
title: Linked OXTR Variants Are Associated with Social Behavior Differences in Bonobos (Pan paniscus)

finding: The SNP rs11544331, which is a germline variation in the GPER gene, resulted in the replacement of proline with leucine at position 16 of the GPER protein. This variation exhibited an attenuated response to the therapeutic compound LNS8801, which is dependent on GPER for anticancer activity. The finding was particularly significant as it suggested that this common variant (present in approximately 50% of the White European population) may serve as a predictive biomarker for the therapeutic response in ongoing human cancer trials involving LNS8801.
title: LNS8801: An enantiomerically pure agonist of the G protein-coupled estrogen receptor suitable for clinical development

finding: The rs11982736 SNP in the PSPH gene demonstrated a strong association with increased appendicular lean mass at genome-wide significance (p=9.2e-17, beta=0.0217) among individuals in the UK Biobank, suggesting its importance in muscle mass regulation.
title: Skeletal muscle hypertrophy rewires glucose metabolism: an experimental investigation and systematic review

finding: The SNP rs6465133 in the SRI gene was found to be significant in distinguishing pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes (PCAND) from Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) with a p-value of 0.001, suggesting its potential role as a biomarker in clinical settings.
title: Sorcin-STAT3-Serpin E1/CCL5 axis can be the trigger of pancreatic cancer-associated new-onset diabetes

finding: Findings associated with SNP rs13246235 indicated its relevance in tumor biology, particularly related to epithelial-to-mesenchymal transition (EMT) and therapies in advanced urothelial cell carcinoma. The research showed that this SNP impacted treatment resistance, thereby influencing the dynamics of CTCs during tumor progression.
title: Biases in the Parsortix® system observed with pancreatic cancer cell lines

finding: The SNP rs149867961 was found to affect PON3 levels as it resides in a promoter and transcription factor binding site. This rare variant was associated with a decrease in PON3 levels, which is implicated in slowing the progression of atherosclerosis. It had a minor allele frequency of 3.1%, and the findings were statistically significant.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The missense variant rs772677677 contributed to the PON3 cis-RV-pQTL and was associated with a decrease in PON3 levels. It exhibited a minor allele frequency of 1.9% and was significantly enriched in the MANOLIS cohort, providing substantial evidence for its role in serum protein variation.
title: Whole genome sequencing analysis of the cardiometabolic proteome

finding: The SNP rs10249294 was strongly associated with the phenotype 'pieces of fresh fruit eaten per day' and was located in a region on chromosome 7q35 that contained olfactory receptor gene OR6B1, highlighting the link between olfactory receptors and fruit intake.
title: Comprehensive genomic analysis of dietary habits in UK Biobank identifies hundreds of genetic loci and establishes causal relationships between educational attainment and healthy eating

finding: The SNP rs1734907 was associated with increased risk of Crohn's disease (OR = 1.16, P = 1.67×10−13) and schizophrenia (OR = 1.07, P = 7.55×10−6). It was identified as a pleiotropic variant influencing both conditions, found approximately 85kb upstream of the EPHB4 gene, which is implicated in both neurological and immune functions.
title: Cross-disorder analysis of schizophrenia and 19 immune diseases reveals genetic correlation

finding: The autism 15 susceptibility signature variant rs7794745 was detected in individuals S6 and S45. Individual S45 exhibited severe bruxism, which is often associated with autism spectrum disorder. The combined physical characteristics and genetic data suggested a significant likelihood of symptom onset pertaining to autism.
title: Interdisciplinary analyses of Bronze Age communities from Western Hungary reveal complex population histories

finding: The SNP rs1990622 (A/A genotype) in <italic>TMEM106B</italic> was associated with a novel neuroglial tauopathy related to FTLD/ALS-TDP, particularly in cases caused by <italic>GRN</italic> mutations. This variant was noted to increase the risk of FTLD-TDP, emphasizing its significance in neurodegenerative conditions.
title: Concurrent tau pathologies in frontotemporal lobar degeneration with TDP-43 pathology

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was identified in a genome-wide association study as a susceptibility locus for Frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD), with the minor G allele correlating with a reduced risk of developing FTLD-TDP dementia, while the major A allele increased risk. This association was confirmed in subsequent studies.
title: A common Alu element insertion in the 3’UTR of TMEM106B is associated with an increased risk of dementia

finding: The coding SNP rs3173615 was found in perfect linkage disequilibrium with rs1990622 and was shown to change a single amino acid in the protective form of the TMEM106B protein. It was noted that the risk T185 TMEM106B isoform demonstrated a slower degradation rate than the protective S185 isoform, contributing to higher protein levels without affecting mRNA expression.
title: A common Alu element insertion in the 3’UTR of TMEM106B is associated with an increased risk of dementia

finding: The SNP rs7789585 was associated with atrial fibrillation (AF) and cardiac arrhythmias, indicating its relevance to heart trait variations. It was located in a cardiomyocyte-specific open chromatin region within the second intron of the KCNH2 gene, suggesting that KCNH2 was the target gene influenced by this variant. This finding correlated with evidence that enhancers in cardiomyocytes for the potassium channel gene KCNH2 are modulated by noncoding risk variants linked to AF.
title: Comprehensive identification of fetal cis-regulatory elements in the human genome by single-cell multi-omics analysis

finding: There was a confirmed association of the Klf14 variant rs4731702 with the etiology of atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD), which included conditions like ischemic stroke and myocardial infarction (MI). This variant was noted as influencing lipid metabolism, specifically showing decreases in HDL-C levels and increases in triglycerides (TG), as identified through genome-wide association studies (GWAS).
title: Krüppel-Like Factor 14 Improves Cardiac Function After Myocardial Infarction

finding: The Klf14 missense variant rs111400400 was suggested to represent a causal risk factor for atherosclerotic-related diseases, indicating its potential influence on the same metabolic pathways as rs4731702. Both variants highlighted the role of KLF14 in regulating metabolism and its associated risks in conditions such as myocardial infarction (MI) and other forms of ASCVD.
title: Krüppel-Like Factor 14 Improves Cardiac Function After Myocardial Infarction

finding: The SNP rs13246251 was linked to diffuse midline gliomas (DMG) and was associated with the H3-K27M mutation, which is known to drive tumorigenesis in these cancers through epigenetic alterations.
title: Dual Targeting of Histone Deacetylases and MYC as Potential Treatment Strategy for H3-K27M Pediatric Gliomas

finding: The finding related to rs13246167 noted its association with immune response in cancer, specifically in the context of CD8+ HLA-DR+ T cells responding to neoadjuvant chemotherapy in breast cancer patients. This SNP was identified in a comprehensive study that underlined its importance in the response of immune cells to therapies, linking it to potential outcomes in tumor microenvironments similar to those observed in pleural mesothelioma.
title: Single cell view of tumor microenvironment gradients in pleural mesothelioma

finding: The eQTL variant rs1008266 was associated with the ETV7 gene, which produces a transcription factor involved in hematopoiesis. This eQTL was colocalised with multiple autoimmune traits such as rheumatoid arthritis and hayfever, indicating its role in immune response modulation.
title: Mapping interindividual dynamics of innate immune response at single-cell resolution

finding: The rs1990622 variant was found to be associated with Alzheimer’s disease and it was reported to regulate TMEM106B expression in human brain tissues. This variant's influence on TMEM106B could be implicated in the pathophysiology of Alzheimer’s, linking it to the observed functions of TMEM106B in myelin lipid metabolism as revealed by the lipidomic analysis in TMEM106B-deficient mice.
title: Lysosomal TMEM106B interacts with galactosylceramidase to regulate myelin lipid metabolism

finding: The SNP rs12113212 was identified in research related to patient-derived papillary thyroid cancer organoids. The findings revealed that this SNP could be associated with the organoid response to treatment using radioactive iodine. Specifically, it was found that the presence of this SNP correlated with the efficacy of treatment in refractoriness scenarios, indicating its potential role in personalizing therapeutic approaches for patients with similar conditions.
title: Patient-derived parathyroid organoids as tracer and drug-screening application model

finding: The rs2854746 variant was strongly associated with total IGFBP-3 and IGF-II serum levels, as well as with sitting height ratio (SHR) but not with birth weight. It was a known expression QTL (eQTL) previously indicated to influence IGFBP3 expression but had the novel association with IGF-II levels. This SNP was also significantly associated with height.
title: Protein QTL analysis of IGF-I and its binding proteins provides insights into growth biology

finding: The rs1858830 polymorphism on the MET gene was associated with potential interactions related to prenatal exposure to PM10 and NO2 in the context of Autism Spectrum Disorder (ASD). This finding suggested a genetic susceptibility that could be exacerbated by environmental factors.
title: A role for gene-environment interactions in Autism Spectrum Disorder is suggested by variants in genes regulating exposure to environmental factors

finding: The rs73156934-tagged CRE was shown to regulate the expression of the target gene CALD1, with perturbation assays confirming its long-distance regulatory capability, despite being intronic and unmarked.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The rs10428917 variant was associated with regulatory functions impacting CALD1 expression through similar mechanisms as rs73156934, demonstrating the potential of unmarked regulatory elements in gene expression modulation.
title: Endogenous fine-mapping of functional regulatory elements in complex genetic loci

finding: The SNP rs1799889, which corresponds to the SERPINE1 (PAI-1) 4G/5G insertion/deletion promoter polymorphism, was found to be associated with an increased risk of pre-eclampsia (PE). The study conducted a systematic review and meta-analysis that revealed a significant relationship between this polymorphism and the incidence of PE, indicating it may play a role in the disease's pathogenesis.
title: HtrA1 alters endothelial tube formation characteristics in an in vitro model

finding: The SNP rs7459185 was associated with type 2 diabetes (T2D) risk, showing a suggestive association in the Finnish population with a beta coefficient of -0.0565 and a P-value of 2.1×10^-6. The allele correlated with decreased T2D risk showed significantly increased inclusion of islet microexons (IsletMICs).
title: Control of pancreatic islet function and glucose homeostasis by a novel microexon program misregulated in type 2 diabetes

finding: The presence of the SNP rs17605251 in the Napepld gene was associated with severe obesity, defined as a BMI of 35 kg/m² or greater. This finding suggested a potential role for NAPE-PLD in the regulation of energy homeostasis, food-motivated behaviors, and metabolic disorders.
title: NAPE-PLD in the ventral tegmental area regulates reward events, feeding and energy homeostasis

finding: Identified as a risk SNP for non-syndromic craniosynostosis, this SNP reached a P-value of 3.02e-14 in the GWAS for normal cranial vault shape, demonstrating its significant role in cranial morphology.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: This SNP was also linked to sagittal non-syndromic craniosynostosis and reached a significant association in the GWAS for cranial vault shape, with a P-value of 2.40e-10.
title: Joint Multi-Ancestry and Admixed GWAS Reveals the Complex Genetics behind Human Cranial Vault Shape

finding: The variant rs62456190 in the PMS2 gene was significant for patients with RN levels between 43.5 and 50.5 units. This indicates its role in modulating age at onset with respect to RN, thus supporting its importance in the genetic analysis of the condition.
title: Identification of representative trees in random forests based on a new tree-based distance measure

finding: The rs113993960 variant, characterized as ΔF508, was confirmed as a causative mutation for cystic fibrosis through recessive inheritance. The incorporation of molecular counting into the analysis model led to enhanced diagnostic sensitivity and specificity exceeding 98% and 99%, respectively. This finding was pivotal in the implementation of sgNIPT for accurate detection of cystic fibrosis.
title: A novel high-throughput molecular counting method with single base-pair resolution enables accurate single-gene NIPT

finding: The SNP rs13246228 was associated with the JAK/STAT signaling pathway, which is critical in the context of lung diseases like lung cancer and asthma. The study reflected its relevance through the activation of STAT3 in non-small cell lung cancer, suggesting that this SNP might influence the disease mechanisms where the JAK/STAT pathway is perturbed, leading to its implications in therapeutic opportunities.
title: Maintaining structural and functional homeostasis of the Drosophila respiratory epithelia requires stress-modulated JAK/STAT activity

finding: This SNP was identified as a lead SNP for a novel locus associated with carotid artery intima-media thickness (cIMT). It was emphasized as part of the largest single study with consistent cIMT measurements in the UK Biobank.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: Acknowledged as a lead SNP for the IMTmax trait, illustrating overlaps with IMTmean and highlighting the importance of this region in vascular health.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: This SNP was identified as a significant locus exclusive to men's analyses for cIMT, contributing to the understanding of sex-specific genetic influences.
title: Carotid intima-media thickness in UK Biobank: Identification of novel genome-wide loci, sex-specific effects and genetic correlations with obesity and glucometabolic traits

finding: The rs2730260 SNP was found in an intron of VIPR2, identified as a significant contributor to myopia. The SNP’s accessibility in Müller glia correlated with VIPR2 expression, supporting it as the primary target gene affected by this variant.
title: Single-cell multiome of the human retina and deep learning nominate causal variants in complex eye diseases

finding: The SNP rs13235995 was linked to impaired chromosome congression in the context of studies involving the TH588 compound and low-dose nocodazole. These studies demonstrated that the SNP influenced microtubule turnover within the mitotic spindle, resulting in significant effects on the congression of polar chromosomes. Specifically, the findings suggested that alterations associated with this SNP could contribute to mitotic errors observed in certain cancer cells, notably those like OVSAHO cells, where proper spindle elongation was crucial for mitigating segregation errors.
title: Microtubule pivoting driven by spindle elongation rescues polar chromosomes to ensure faithful mitosis

finding: The SNP rs12113142 was associated with functional activity of the Notch signaling pathway, as detailed in the work by Canté-Barrett et al. The study established a molecular test for quantifying Notch signaling in human cancer, highlighting the relevance of this SNP in understanding pathway activity in stem cell research.
title: Measurement of activity of developmental signal transduction pathways to quantify stem cell pluripotency and phenotypically characterize differentiated cells

finding: The SNP rs4473920, located on chromosome 7 within the CDCA7L gene, was identified as a meQTL hub locus. It had significant associations with 1,119 independent distal CpG-sites across all autosomes, indicating its involvement in modulating methylation changes in a trans-acting manner.
title: Genetic control of KRAB-ZFP genes explains distal CpG-site methylation which associates with human disease phenotypes

finding: The CARD9 G111S mutation (rs387907352) was demonstrably activated and corresponded to the CARD11 G123S mutation linked to BENTA, indicating a positive finding associated with an oncogenic context.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: CARD11 G123D (rs571517554) was compared to CARD9 G111E (rs371695061), both mutations causing severe phenotypes. However, no health data was publicly available for this specific mutation in CARD9.
title: “Franken-CARD9”: chimeric proteins for high-resolution studies of activating mutations in CARD10, CARD11 and CARD14

finding: SNP rs11766679 was linked with gene DPP6, which is also associated with multiple genetic diseases.
title: Locating suspicious lethal genes by abnormal distributions of SNP patterns

finding: The SNP rs12113168 was associated with nutrigenomic signaling related to the downregulation of the UNC5A gene during colon carcinogenesis. This finding highlighted the role of O-GlcNAc Transferase in linking dietary influences with epigenetic modifications, which consequently posed impacts on health outcomes and cancer development.
title: Nutrigenomic Regulation of Sensory Plasticity

finding: This SNP in the TMEM106B gene showed genome-wide significant association with CSF NF-L levels and is a lead variant associated with both neurodegenerative processes and FTLD risk as previously confirmed by other studies.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This SNP was associated with FTLD and showed strong linkage disequilibrium with rs1548884, indicating potential shared genetic risks between CSF NF-L levels and neurodegenerative diseases.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: This variant was in high linkage disequilibrium with rs1548884 and indicated its potential as a pQTL/eQTL for TMEM106B, connecting it to neuropsychiatric traits and CSF NF-L.
title: TMEM106B and CPOX are genetic determinants of cerebrospinal fluid Alzheimer’s disease biomarker levels

finding: The variant rs149048452, located in the STAG3 gene, showed a significant negative effect on testosterone levels in females with a beta of -0.33 and a p-value of 8.94×10^-9. STAG3 is known to be a part of the cohesin complex involved in meiosis, and mutations in this gene have previously been associated with premature ovarian failure.
title: Sex-specific genetic effects across biomarkers

finding: The variant rs17853284 in the POR gene was associated with a negative effect on testosterone levels in females with a beta of -0.23 and a p-value of 8.91×10^-15. The POR gene encodes a cytochrome P450 oxidoreductase, and deficiencies in this gene can lead to amenorrhea, disordered steroidogenesis, and congenital adrenal hyperplasia. This association with testosterone levels had not been discovered prior to this study.
title: Sex-specific genetic effects across biomarkers

finding: The sentinel SNP rs1990622 at the TMEM106B locus was analyzed, revealing that minor (C)-allele homozygotes exhibited more global TDP-43 pathology as well as increased pathology in specific brain regions among ALS cases. The analysis indicated a significant difference in TDP-43 pathology scores under a major (T)-allele dominant model, where homozygotes for the minor allele (CC) showed the highest global TDP-43 pathology scores (p = 0.018). This finding was unexpected, as previous studies linked the C allele to a reduced risk of developing FTLD-TDP and cognitive decline in other disorders. However, in the context of ALS, the C allele associated with lower TMEM106B expression was linked to more TDP-43 pathology, which suggested a complex role for TMEM106B in ALS pathology.
title: TMEM106B modifies TDP-43 pathology in human ALS brain and cell-based models of TDP-43 proteinopathy

finding: The SNP rs10480060-T was associated with altered T lymphocyte count, supported by a significant p-value of 9x10^-15 and a risk allele frequency of 51.8%. This finding indicated that loss of ADAP1 function, which dampened T cell signaling, could contribute to abnormal leukocyte count, reflecting its role in T cell proliferation.
title: ADAP1 promotes latent HIV-1 reactivation by selectively tuning a T cell signaling-transcriptional axis

finding: The SNP rs78582080-T showed a high significance for association with altered T lymphocyte count, with a p-value of 3x10^-12 and a risk allele frequency of 56.5%. This finding was consistent with the impairment of T cell function due to ADAP1 loss, correlating with observations of abnormal T cell proliferation and physiology.
title: ADAP1 promotes latent HIV-1 reactivation by selectively tuning a T cell signaling-transcriptional axis

finding: The P284T mutation in POR (rs72557937) was shown to retain some activity with R264C-CYP19A1, but its overall effects suggested a more significant conformational dependency on interactions between POR and CYP19A1 variants.
title: Differential effects of variations in human P450 oxidoreductase on the aromatase activity of CYP19A1 polymorphisms R264C and R264H

finding: The SNP rs10808026 was linked to the gene EPHA1, which was the nearest gene to this LOAD-GWAS SNP. Additionally, the DEG TCAF1 was identified in the excitatory neuron subtype (Exc1) within this LOAD region, indicating an association with dysregulation of genes in proximity to the SNP.
title: Integrative single-nucleus multi-omics analysis prioritizes candidate cis and trans regulatory networks and their target genes in Alzheimer’s disease brains

finding: The variant rs12699323 was annotated as an intron variant linked to the expression of the gene TMEM106B. This finding was part of successful fine-mapping efforts that aimed to narrow down the credible sets to single variants.
title: Multi-ancestry GWAS of major depression aids locus discovery, fine-mapping, gene prioritisation, and causal inference

finding: The genetic variant rs2069837, located in the second intron of the IL6 gene, was identified as a risk allele for Takayasu arteritis. The A allele was shown to have a protective effect against chronic viral infections and various types of cancer. Through experiments, it was demonstrated that this allele repressed the expression of the anti-inflammatory gene GPNMB by recruiting the MEF2-HDAC complex, leading to enhanced susceptibility to Takayasu arteritis. Additionally, this allele was associated with other conditions such as spastic tetraplegia and antipsychotic-induced weight gain. In monocyte-derived macrophages, individuals with the AA genotype exhibited significantly lower GPNMB expression compared to those with the AG genotype, which could be restored through histone deacetylase inhibition.
title: Multi-disease associated risk locus in IL6 represses the anti-inflammatory gene GPNMB through chromatin looping and recruiting MEF2-HDAC complex

finding: The variant rs2242480 of CYP3A4 was associated with the metabolism of Sirolimus, an immunosuppressant. The allele frequencies varied significantly among populations, with gnomAD reporting frequencies of 0.09 in European, 0.74 in African American, and 0.37 in Hispanic populations. The local ancestry derived AMR allele frequency was found to be 0.67, which was nearly twice that of the Hispanic allele frequency.
title: Pharmacogenetic allele variant frequencies: An analysis of the VA’s Million Veteran Program (MVP) as a representation of the diversity in US population

finding: The controlling variant rs776746 of CYP3A5 affected the metabolism of Tacrolimus, another immunosuppressant. The allele frequencies showed significant variability among the major MVP groups, with reported frequencies of 0.07 in European, 0.70 in African American, and 0.21 in Hispanic populations. A notable difference was also observed between the Hispanic and local ancestry derived AMR allele frequency, which was 0.31 for AMR.
title: Pharmacogenetic allele variant frequencies: An analysis of the VA’s Million Veteran Program (MVP) as a representation of the diversity in US population

finding: The SNP rs7794745 was identified in a study that explored its association with autism in the Iranian population. This finding contributed to the growing body of evidence linking genetic variations in the CNTNAP2 gene to autism spectrum disorders (ASD). The original research highlighted this SNP's relevance as a potential genetic marker within the context of ASD etiology.
title: Deep embedded clustering by relevant scales and genome-wide association study in autism

finding: The SNP rs6465878, located in the FBXL13 gene, demonstrated an association with Module 3 of the protein modules identified in the study. This association was observed at a relaxed significance threshold of 5×10^-7, indicating a potential link to immune-related disease pathways relevant to respiratory issues in children.
title: Network Analysis Reveals Protein Modules Associated with Childhood Respiratory Diseases

finding: The SNP rs74504435 was identified as a significant risk locus for Alzheimer's disease (AD) with a high posterior inclusion probability (PIP) of 0.986 when fine mapping was conducted with annotations from all brain cell types. This SNP demonstrated the highest PIP of 0.981 specifically in astrocytes, a refined cell type context, which indicates its crucial role in AD pathology. Further analysis revealed that the risk allele 'A' of rs74504435 was associated with a decrease in DNA methylation (DNAm) levels at a CpG site located within an enhancer linked to the promoter of the epidermal growth factor receptor (EGFR). The risk allele was found to reduce DNAm levels from 0.46 to 0.19 compared to the reference allele 'C'. This reduction in DNAm was hypothesized to enhance enhancer activity and subsequently increase EGFR expression level, which has been implicated in amyloid-β induced memory loss and neuroinflammation in the context of AD.
title: Deep learning predicts DNA methylation regulatory variants in specific brain cell types and enhances fine mapping for brain disorders

finding: The transferrin receptor 2 rs7385804 variant was potentially linked to the origin of multiple sclerosis (MS) as per a recent study.
title: Identification of candidate biomarkers and pathways associated with multiple sclerosis using bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The analysis revealed that the SNP rs10275045, located approximately 5kb upstream on chromosome 22, was in strong linkage disequilibrium (R² = 0.93) with a duplication that was identified between chromosome 22 and chromosome 7. This duplication was associated with one of the strongest genetic signals in schizophrenia, indicating a potential role in the disorder. The duplicated segment also contained regulatory elements, as it was reported to be in a region annotated as a strong enhancer according to the ENCODE project data. Therefore, the findings emphasized rs10275045's significance in genetic susceptibility to schizophrenia.
title: Insights into dispersed duplications and complex structural mutations from whole genome sequencing 706 families

finding: The SNP rs1207733 was one of five consecutive SNPs identified within a haplotype that demonstrated Neandertal-like alleles shared by at least 80% of individuals analyzed from the 1000 Genomes dataset. This haplotype belonged to the DLX5/6-N-Haplotype, which was significantly longer than expected under the null hypothesis of incomplete lineage sorting, indicating its Archaic origin.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: The SNP rs1005169 was included in the previously mentioned haplotype characterized by Neandertal-like alleles. Its presence further supported the identification of the DLX5/6-N-Haplotype as significant and indicative of Archaic lineage due to the exceptionally long haplotype distance observed.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: The SNP rs1724297, along with the other SNPs analyzed, was a part of the haplotype that showed strong evidence of an Archaic origin. This SNP contributed to the understanding of human evolution with respect to the DLX5/6 locus and its relevance to sociability and longevity.
title: DLX5/6 GABAergic expression affects social vocalization: implications for human evolution

finding: The trans-acting SNP rs10276582 was associated with CCL4 protein production and showed a significant eQTL effect on the AMZ1 gene expression levels, implicating it in the regulation of CCL4 depending on genotype.
title: Integration of Candida albicans-induced single-cell gene expression data and circulatory protein concentrations reveal genetic regulators of inflammation

finding: The SNP rs4252424 in the TRPV5 calcium channel gene was positively associated with lead poisoning in a study conducted on Chinese workers. This association underscored the potential role of TRPV5 in mediating the effects of lead exposure, suggesting that variations in this gene could influence susceptibility to lead toxicity.
title: Intracellular helix-loop-helix domain modulates inactivation kinetics of mammalian TRPV5 and TRPV6 channels

finding: Associated with blood cell percentages, prostate malignancy, and also exhibiting evidence for selection (s = 0.005; logLR = 16.49), rs11762534 was found at higher frequencies in Arabian populations (66%) compared to global populations, particularly within Bedouins (81%).
title: The Genomic History of the Middle East

finding: At the CALD1 locus for the lung capacity trait FEV1/FVC, the PIP for the intronic variant rs17168118 improved from 0.78 to 0.98 when the primary cV2F score was used. This variant was implicated by cCRE, Enformer, ChromBPNet, FUNCODE, and MPRA features, and was strongly linked to the CALD1 gene, which has been involved in regulating smooth muscle contraction and has a known role in pulmonary fibrosis.
title: A consensus variant-to-function score to functionally prioritize variants for disease

finding: The analysis determined the allelic locus rs713598, which was associated with G, C, or G/C (heterozygous) variants in different individuals. The study demonstrated that using a single base pair mismatch approach, the FELUDA assay could successfully distinguish individuals with each of these genotypes. Additionally, it was corroborated that cleavage differed across the variants: negligible cleavage was observed with the G variant, maximum cleavage occurred with the C variant, and intermediate cleavage was noted with the G/C variant. This SNP was linked to sensory responsiveness and food preferences, as reported in previous research.
title: Rapid, field-deployable nucleobase detection and identification using FnCas9

finding: This SNP, located in the CD36 gene, was confirmed to be associated with plasmalogen levels and also revealed novel associations with sphingomyelins and ceramides, indicating its relevance in lipid metabolism.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This missense variant located in the MLXIPL gene was shown to be associated with diacylglycerol (DAG) levels, linking it to vascular function and related diseases.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: Located in the 3' UTR of TBL2, this SNP demonstrated association with diacylglycerol levels, indicating potential genetic determinants affecting vascular health.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: This variant in PTPRN2 was associated with propyl 4-hydroxybenzoate sulfate, indicating its potential role in metabolic pathways related to males.
title: Genetic Architecture and Analysis Practices of Circulating Metabolites in the NHLBI Trans-Omics for Precision Medicine (TOPMed) Program

finding: The rs11556924 variant in ZC3HC1 was implicated as a causal variant in one of the CAD loci with past associations, adding to the understanding of genetic contributions to CAD.
title: Population-specific and transethnic genome-wide analyses reveal distinct and shared genetic risks of coronary artery disease

finding: The SNP rs42046, associated with EGPA, is also linked to eosinophil count and rheumatoid arthritis, highlighting its broader relevance in inflammatory diseases.
title: Genetically distinct clinical subsets, and associations with asthma and eosinophil abundance, within Eosinophilic Granulomatosis with Polyangiitis

finding: The minor (C) allele of rs706014 was associated with decreased triglycerides (TG) in both Africans (β -0.75, p=2.5×10⁻⁹) and in AA (β -0.084, p=0.0093). This variant was known for its involvement in eQTLs impacting GPNMB expression relevant to triglyceride metabolism.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The minor (C) allele of rs7797481, an intronic variant in ORC5, was associated with higher low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDLC) in both West Africans and AA. The variant indicated an alteration in regulatory motifs for FOXA, implicated in lipid metabolism.
title: GWAS in Africans identifies novel lipids loci and demonstrates heterogenous association within Africa

finding: The SNP rs1534696 was mapped to the gene SNX10 and demonstrated significant gene-by-sex interaction (GxSex) in waist-hip ratio adjusted BMI (WHRadjBMI), with a p-value of 6.2 × 10^-11. This variant was found to regulate diet-induced adipose expansion specifically in female mice, indicating a potential role in sex-specific adiposity.
title: Accounting for genetic effect heterogeneity in fine-mapping and improving power to detect gene-environment interactions with SharePro

finding: The SNP rs7789585 was supported by TF motif evidence suggesting that a mutation to the reference allele G would disrupt GCM1 binding. This disruption was hypothesized to interrupt the active enhancer state at the KCNH2 locus, which was subsequently confirmed by Hocker and colleagues using reporter assays. The finding related to its effect on cardiomyocyte electrophysiologic function.
title: Annotating and prioritizing human non-coding variants with RegulomeDB

finding: Associated with anthropometric measures and hypospadias; its archaic allele affected measures of height and weight.
title: Long-range regulatory effects of Neandertal DNA in modern humans

finding: The non-synonymous mutation p.Asp100Asn (rs724159998) was previously linked to congenital leptin deficiency and was detected in extremely obese children that were homozygous carriers, supporting the pathogenicity of such variants in severe obesity.
title: Prevalence Estimates of Putatively Pathogenic Leptin Variants in the gnomAD Database

finding: This SNP (p.Asn103Lys) was reported in the context of congenital leptin deficiency, being associated with extremely obese children who were homozygous carriers. The presence of this variant correlated with higher BMI z-scores in carriers.
title: Prevalence Estimates of Putatively Pathogenic Leptin Variants in the gnomAD Database

finding: The rs748670681 variant in the TNRC18 gene was associated with increased risk for specific inflammatory diseases in the Finnish population. It was identified as a causal SNP in several immune-mediated diseases, demonstrating opposite effects for inflammatory versus autoimmune conditions. The minor allele T was linked to decreased expression of TNRC18 and its adjacent gene WIPI2, along with reduced cytokine production and impaired LPS-dependent signaling, while enhancing interferon signaling. This variant showcased pleiotropic regulatory effects, making it a significant finding in the context of inflammatory diseases.
title: A genome-wide CRISPR screen supported by human genetics identifies the TNRC18 gene locus as a novel regulator of inflammatory signaling

finding: SNP rs4948102 at locus 7p11.2 was associated with increased risk of retinal transparency and leakage in the RPE in both the MacTel area and progression area, while also providing protection against leakage in the outer layer of the foveal area.
title: Genetic Disruption of Serine Biosynthesis is a Key Driver of Macular Telangiectasia Type 2 Etiology and Progression

finding: The rs10486567 variant contributed to prostate cancer susceptibility through long-range chromatin interactions with regulatory elements, specifically with the promoter regions of associated genes.
title: Exploring the effects of genetic variation on gene regulation in cancer in the context of 3D genome structure

finding: The SNP rs11772180 was identified as a significant cis-eQTL, influencing GHRHR expression levels. It showed effects on several age-sensitive phenotypes in humans, including platelet count and cholesterol-associated measures. Notably, the variant associated with low GHRHR expression impacted these age-sensitive phenotypes in a manner that countered the expected age-dependent changes, confirming that the observed effects were predominantly age-independent.
title: Deep Phenotyping and Lifetime Trajectories Reveal Limited Effects of Longevity Regulators on the Aging Process in C57BL/6J Mice

finding: The SNP rs764282 was notable for its previous association with expressive vocabulary and displayed a high linkage disequilibrium with rs9854781. Its role in early language development was reaffirmed by being linked to a known locus in early-phase expressive vocabulary measures.
title: Genome-wide analyses of vocabulary size in infancy and toddlerhood: associations with Attention-Deficit/Hyperactivity Disorder and cognition-related traits

finding: The variant rs11766001 was significantly associated with Hirschsprung disease (HSCR), showing an odds ratio (OR) of 1.5 (P=1.3×10^-6) and an allele frequency of 19% in HSCR cases compared to 14% in controls. This finding was consistent with prior associations.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: Similar to rs11766001, the variant rs12707682 demonstrated significant association with HSCR, with an OR of 1.6 (P=2.6×10^-11) and an allele frequency of 31% in cases against 23% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: At the SEMA3 locus, rs1228877 exhibited a significant association with HSCR, with an OR of 1.6 (P=2.6×10^-16), showing an allele frequency of 45% in cases compared to 33% in controls.
title: Multiple, independent, common variants overlapping known and putative gut enhancers at RET, SEMA3 and NRG1 underlie Hirschsprung disease risk in European ancestry subjects

finding: The rs2960785 variant localized in an intergenic enhancer between the SKAP2 and HOXA1 genes in Neutrophils. It had an equal p-value association with both the cmQTL score and gene expressions of SKAP2 and HOXA1, indicating it as a likely causal variant influencing CM activity.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The variant rs774267 was also associated with the SKAP2 locus in Neutrophils, where two cmQTLs localized nearby impacting gene expressions, but the specific role of this SNP in the regulatory activity was less highlighted than rs2960785.
title: Non-coding variants impact cis-regulatory coordination in a cell type-specific manner

finding: The ABCB1 rs1045642 SNP was associated with the efficacy and safety of amlodipine in treating hypertension among Caucasian patients, underscoring its pharmacogenetic implications.
title: Screening and identification of key biomarkers in diabetic kidney disease and its complications: Evidence from bioinformatics and next generation sequencing data analysis

finding: The P284T variant of POR (rs72557937) was identified in the Yoruba population, and the study found that this variant severely affected cytochrome P450 activities. Specifically, P284T resulted in reduced activities of CYP19A1 (aromatase) to 9% of wild type, CYP2C9 to 26% of wild type, CYP2C19 to 44% of wild type, CYP3A4 to 23% of wild type, and CYP3A5 to 44% of wild type. These findings suggested a negative impact on steroid hormone biosynthesis as well as drug metabolism in individuals carrying this variant.
title: Loss of multiple enzyme activities due to the human genetic variation P284T in NADPH cytochrome P450 oxidoreductase

finding: The study identified the SNP rs12113141 in relation to the cholinergic receptor, particularly the nAChR-α7 subtype, which was highlighted as being involved in the pathway that affects lung adenocarcinoma progression, especially in never-smokers. The investigation revealed that increased levels of acetylcholine and nAChR-α7 expression in hypoxic conditions were crucial in modulating the PI3K/AKT pathway and stabilizing HIF-1α, suggesting that this SNP could play a significant role in lung cancer pathogenesis independent of smoking.
title: Interaction of hypoxia and nicotine acetylcholine receptor signaling network reveals a novel mechanism for lung adenocarcinoma progression in never-smokers

finding: The SNP rs12536129, located at chr7:46,169,621, represented a G to A change that was associated with significant alterations in 3D genome organization. This variant was identified to have the largest effect on 3D genome folding in a window that included the insulin-like growth factor binding protein 3 gene (IGFBP3). This allele, derived from Neanderthals, has remained at high frequency in modern human populations, particularly noted in Peruvian individuals, where its frequency reached 28%. In addition, this SNP served as an eQTL for IGFBP3 and was linked to multiple phenotypic traits such as standing height, trunk fat ratio, impedance measures, and diastolic blood pressure. Its effects demonstrated how an introgressed allele contributed to variation in important traits in modern humans.
title: Reconstructing the 3D genome organization of Neanderthals reveals that chromatin folding shaped phenotypic and sequence divergence

finding: The lead SNP rs212672, located approximately 355 kb downstream of TWIST1 at the 7p21.1 locus, was significantly associated with facial shape in a GWAS meta-analysis involving 8246 individuals of recent European ancestry. The major allele (T) of this SNP was linked to notable changes in facial morphology, resulting in a less protrusive and wider nose, a shorter and less protrusive upper lip, and a more prominent chin and forehead. The strongest associations identified were with facial structures derived from cranial neural crest cells, specifically the nose and upper lip, indicating a crucial role of genetic variations near TWIST1 in determining human facial features.
title: TWIST1 interacts with adherens junction proteins during neural tube development and regulates fate transition in cranial neural crest cells

finding: The SNP rs13225672 was linked to a radiomic-based model that predicted lymph node involvement in prostate cancer patients. This finding was relevant to the assessment and prognosis of prostate cancer, showcasing the role of genetic variants in determining disease progression and treatment outcomes.
title: DeepComBat: A Statistically Motivated, Hyperparameter-Robust, Deep Learning Approach to Harmonization of Neuroimaging Data

finding: This SNP was associated with the microRNA gene sets hsa-let-7d-3p and hsa-let-7i-3p in excitatory neurons, with nominal p-values of 8.03×10^-6 and 2.36×10^-4, respectively. Both microRNAs had previously been implicated in Alzheimer’s disease (AD) pathology.
title: gsQTL: Associating genetic risk variants with gene sets by exploiting their shared variability

finding: The SNP rs12113166 was discussed in the context of targeting CREB as a potential candidate in cancer therapy, highlighting its relevance to cancer treatment strategies. This finding suggested that variations at this SNP locus could influence the efficacy of therapies aimed at CREB pathways.
title: Widespread variation in molecular interactions and regulatory properties among transcription factor isoforms

finding: The secondary eQTL for IRF5 at rs17424921 showed significant colocalisation with systemic lupus erythematosus risk loci, marking it as an important genetic influence in this autoimmune condition.
title: Natural Killer cells demonstrate distinct eQTL and transcriptome-wide disease associations, highlighting their role in autoimmunity

finding: The study by Gao et al. (2016) reported that the SNX13 rs4142995 SNP was associated with serum lipid levels in the Jing and Han populations. This finding highlighted the relevance of SNX13 in lipid metabolism, which is consistent with literature surrounding the role of SNX14 in lipid homeostasis. The connection indicates that variations in SNPs related to SNX genes may have implications on lipid levels and related metabolic pathways, aligning with studies that examined mutations in the SNX14 gene causing spinocerebellar ataxia and its involvement in lipid biogenesis.
title: Diverse Species-Specific Phenotypic Consequences of Loss of Function Sorting Nexin 14 Mutations

finding: The SNP rs1990622 was identified as a genetic risk factor for frontotemporal lobar degeneration (FTLD) primarily associated with TDP-43 aggregates. Additionally, it was linked to FTLD caused by C9ORF72 mutations, cognitive impairment in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), Alzheimer’s disease (AD), Parkinson’s disease (PD), chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), hippocampal sclerosis in aging (HS-Aging), and limbic-predominant age-related TDP-43 encephalopathy (LATE), which indicated its significant role in various neurodegenerative processes. The risk allele was also associated with increased Purkinje cell degeneration in humans.
title: Loss of TMEM106B exacerbates Tau pathology and neurodegeneration in PS19 mice

finding: The SNP rs3173615, specifically the T185 variant, demonstrated a positive association with increased phosphorylated Tau (AT8) density, neuroinflammation, synaptic dysfunction, and ante-mortem dementia in individuals with chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE). This finding highlighted TMEM106B's influence on Tau pathology and its associated neurodegenerative effects.
title: Loss of TMEM106B exacerbates Tau pathology and neurodegeneration in PS19 mice

finding: The rs2069845 SNP was associated with the change in circulating IL-6 levels following total joint replacement surgery. Specifically, patients with the A,A allele had increasing levels of IL-6 post-operatively, while those with the G,A allele had decreasing levels. This suggested that the G,A allele might protect against inflammation-induced bone loss associated with peri-implant osteolysis.
title: Polymorphisms in rs2069845 are associated with IL-6 and soluble IL-6 receptor levels during total joint replacement

finding: The SNP rs4731702 was significantly associated with the expression of KLF14 in adipose tissue, functioning in a cis-acting manner across multiple cohorts. Additionally, this variant was linked to the expression of 385 genes throughout the genome in a trans-acting manner, highlighting its regulatory impact on gene expression relevant to adipose tissue and potentially contributing to fat distribution related to WHRadjBMI.
title: Systems genetics analysis of human body fat distribution genes identifies Wnt signaling and mitochondrial activity in adipocytes

finding: The SNP rs2285947, a mutation of the DNAH11 gene, was identified as a potential risk factor for both ovarian cancer and breast cancer. Its relationship to prognosis was previously unclear, but in this study, it was suggested that the presence of this SNP may contribute to increased mortality risk.
title: Machine learning enables accurate prediction of breast cancer five-year survival using somatic genomic variants

finding: The study found an 11-nucleotide deletion in exon 9 of the ATG9B gene, specifically the variant rs747858674, which resulted in a frameshift mutation (p.Leu695fs). This mutation was associated with a rare genetic disorder in homozygous pediatric patients who exhibited neurodevelopmental anomalies, including mental retardation. The variant showed a global frequency of 0.00008640, with the highest frequency found in Middle Eastern and Ashkenazi Jewish populations, indicating its rarity.
title: Characterization of a novel neurodevelopmental rare disease caused by a mutation within the autophagy gene ATG9B

finding: In the rs2158799 variant, which was identified as a sc-eQTL for the gene JAZF1 specifically in monocytes, Decima's predictions indicated that the most significant effect of this variant on JAZF1 expression took place within monocytes. The findings also highlighted that this variant overlaps with a distal regulatory element that is crucial for JAZF1's expression in this particular cell type, but not in other types. Furthermore, it was noted that the alternate allele of this variant disrupts a C/EBP motif, which is vital in regulating myeloid lineage development, including that of monocytes. This disruption inferred that the variant likely influences the accessibility of an enhancer specific to the cell type.
title: Decoding sequence determinants of gene expression in diverse cellular and disease states

finding: This SNP was associated with allelic imbalance in PILRB across multiple neural cell types, suggesting it plays a role in gene expression regulation relevant to AD.
title: Allele-specific analysis reveals exon- and cell-type-specific regulatory effects of Alzheimer’s disease-associated genetic variants

finding: The SNP rs6465098 was identified as an eQTL for the gene HSPB1 in D52 cells at a false discovery rate (FDR) of less than 5%. HSPB1 encodes a heat shock protein implicated in neuronal differentiation, with changes in its expression observed in neuronal contexts related to ischemia and Alzheimer disease.
title: Population-scale single-cell RNA-seq profiling across dopaminergic neuron differentiation

finding: The SNP rs740104 was associated with CSF levels of N-Acetylhistidine and other inter-correlated metabolites at the NAT16 locus on chromosome 7, with significant <italic>P</italic> values of 8.33e-74 and others reaching up to 4.68e-25.
title: Quantitative trait loci mapping of circulating metabolites in cerebrospinal fluid to uncover biological mechanisms involved in brain-related phenotypes

finding: The SNP rs1799983 was associated with PVWMH and resulted in an amino acid change in the NOS3 gene. This SNP was part of a novel region on chromosome 7q36.1 that contained significant exonic variants.
title: Common genetic variation indicates separate etiologies for periventricular and deep white matter hyperintensities

finding: The SNP rs11556924 in the ZC3HC1 gene was positively associated with hypertension in a Finnish population, as detailed in the TAMRISK study. This finding indicated that individuals with this variant had a higher prevalence of hypertension. Furthermore, the same SNP was also associated with increased carotid intima-media thickness in patients suffering from rheumatoid arthritis, suggesting its relevance in cardiovascular and inflammatory contexts.
title: Nuclear basket protein ZC3HC1 and its yeast homolog Pml39p feature an evolutionary conserved bimodular construction essential for initial binding to NPC-anchored homologs of scaffold protein TPR

finding: The SNP rs714584 in the CNTNAP2 gene was associated with everyday drinking compared to the never drinking group. It had previously been associated with alcohol addiction in females and involved in neurological functions.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: The SNP rs740114 in AUTS2 was associated with OWD with p = 1.1e-3 and was not in LD with rs6943555.
title: Genome-wide association study of alcohol consumption in Russian population

finding: Associated with mode 11<sub>62</sub> related to ventricle volume, this SNP was likely in gene GNA12, which is important for neuron migration during brain development.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations

finding: Found to lie within the FAM3C gene span, this SNP was correlated with several variables such as bone density loss and Alzheimer’s disease, linking it to aging.
title: Brain aging comprises multiple modes of structural and functional change with distinct genetic and biophysical associations
